meta.name: The Colour out of Oz
meta.description: Venture into the worlds of both L. Frank Baum and H.P. Lovecraft as you attempt to expel the Colour from Earth with the assistance of the wonderous creatures from the Land of Oz. You will need all the help you can get as the Colour rapidly warps the world around it. Is there truly a way to stop the alien corruption? Or is Oz simply ground zero for the doom of Earth? Keep your wits and well-being as you fight to drive the Colour back into space!
meta.author: The Beard

cards.name: The Road to Oz
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X.  X is equal to the current act number.
[elder_thing]: -2.  If this is a test against a pervasive enemy, reveal another token.

cards.name: The Road to Oz
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X.  X is equal to 1 + the current act number.
[elder_thing]: -3.  If this is a test against a pervasive enemy, reveal another token.

cards.flavor: The woman with the star gives a little explanation as she awaits your decision to see the sorcerer.  "We are the mangaboos, and you are not the first to trespass in our country.  Our glass city has been damaged before by careless outsiders.  No doubt the sorcerer expected more of your kind to follow this new destruction."  The woman's words are as emotionless as she is, making the words "your kind" seem particularly suspect.  Are these people even human?
cards.name: Strangers in a Strange Land
Misadventure
cards.text:
At every point of this foray, you have been under constant attack by the fantastical threats of this island. Many of them seem intelligent, but they seem indifferent to your insistence that the Colour is the greater threat that you are trying to stop. The Colour, in point of fact, has already begin to manifest throughout your journey inward, and grows steadily stronger. You stumble across a particularly large chunk which suddenly erupts, scoring you with a sensation both burning and freezing at once. If more of the color already peppers the outer island, you may never find the source. You must retreat and find a new approach.
Each investigator is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (your choice).

cards.flavor: While you smooth out this difficulty, you take care not to forget your mission to locate the Colour.  Whatever the lights above the city are, they do not appear related, as the mangaboos seem used to their presence.  The meteorite must have impacted further inland.  The problem now is how to push inward, as a tall line of mountains hems this section of the island in -- or out, rather.
cards.name: Mountains Out of Molehills
cards.text: Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at Black Pit, advance.

cards.name: Over and Under Hill
cards.text:
The royal mangaboo you picked from the garden seizes the star from her predecessor, placing it on her forehead daintily. With a more favorable ruler and the sorcerer's accusations silenced, the mangaboos guide you to a small cave in one of the mountains. You bid farewell quickly before the emotionless people can find reason to be suspicious of you again.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Move each revealed location with Victory X and no clues on it to the victory display. Remove each location except for Black Pit from the game. Discard each enemy and treachery at those locations. Choose two of the three Invisible Valley locations at random and put them into play. Remove the other copy of Invisible Valley from the game. Put the First Landing and Second Landing locations into play.

cards.flavor: Despite the darkness of the cave, the passage is easy to traverse, and arrives at another idyllic landscape.  Beyond this valley, a single angled mountain rises above its neighbors.  You sight a narrow pathway coiling up around the mountain and up into the clouds, out of sight.  As the only way you can see out of the valley, your course is clear.
cards.name: The Valley and the Pyramid
cards.text: [action] If you control 2[per_investigator] or more clues as a group: Fight. This attack targets Invisible Bears, uses [intellect] instead of [combat], and deals +1 damage. Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at Second Landing, advance.

cards.name: The Wooden Country
cards.text:
Now far above the invisible valley, the gloom around the pyramid mountain gradually begins to fade. You continue up and through another layer of clouds to another strange spectacle. The landscape before your eyes -- from flat plains to distant hills -- is made entirely of wood. You step cautiously forward, but your incursion is immediately noticed by grotesque wooden creatures that observe you from a short distance... slowly beginning to amass.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Move each revealed location with Victory X and no clues on it to the victory display. Remove each location except for Second Landing from the game. Discard each enemy and treachery at those locations. Choose two of the three City of the Gargoyles locations at random and put them into play. Remove the other copy of City of the Gargoyles from the game. Put the Country of the Gargoyles and Prison Tower locations into play.

cards.flavor: The growing legion of carved gargoyles leers at you, scattered about the wooden landscape.  You must evade them, but where to?  All around you are wooden mountains surrounding the strange country.  You've come too far to simply flee back down the mountain.  There must be a way to escape the gargoyles' country and continue inland.
cards.name: Escape From the Gargoyles
cards.text: [reaction] After you initiate an evasion attempt against Gargoyles, spend 1 ammo from a [[Firearm]] asset you control: You get +3 skill value for this test. Very loud noises can repel the Gargoyles! Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at Prison Tower, investigators may spend the requisite number of clues as a group to advance.

cards.name: On a Wing and a Prayer
cards.text:
Through your various encounters with the gargoyles, you manage to separate a few from their wooden wings. At the prison tower -- the highest building in their city -- you construct a makeshift glider powered by the borrowed wings. There's no time to test with the silent creatures on constant vigil. You and your companions get a running start and make a leap for freedom.
((→R2))

cards.flavor: It quickly becomes apparent that while you are within the city, you can walk through the air as the citizens can.  None of the mangaboos have offered you any explanation of why this is so.
cards.name: Glass City
cards.text: [reaction] When you would move from Glass City: Disengage from each enemy engaged with you.

cards.flavor: Each part of the city -- from the buildings themselves to the furniture inside them -- is completely made of glass.  Comfort was not in mind when it was built.
cards.name: Glass City

cards.flavor:
The sorcerer is a gaunt, thorny man clad in yellow clothes.
He sits on a glass throne, regarding you with emotionless scrutiny.
cards.name: House of the Sorcerer
cards.text: [action]: Parley. The sorcerer sees your dispute of his prediction as a threat to his authority. Test any skill (3) to accept the sorcerer's challenge. This test gets +1 difficulty for each clue on House of the Sorcerer. If you succeed, remember that you have "dealt with the sorcerer." If you fail, take 1 damage or 1 horror.

cards.flavor: The main paths of the city all lead to a tall domed building in the middle of the glass city.  The woman with the star confirms that this is where the sorcerer resides.
cards.name: House of the Sorcerer

cards.flavor: You discover that the mangaboos themselves are growing on the bushes!  The gardeners point out the royal bush, but warn to stay away from it on orders of the current princess.  According to them, new royals grow to steadily replace the former ones.  Perhaps a new princess would be more favorable toward you?
cards.name: Mangaboo Gardens
cards.text: [free] Investigators at Mangaboo Gardens spend 3[per_investigator] clues as a group: Remember that you "picked a new ruler."  Remove Mangaboos from the game.

cards.flavor: Beyond rows of hedges, tall flowering bushes sit in well-tended rows.  You can't make out what is growing on the bushes, but they don't look like normal blooms.
cards.name: Mangaboo Gardens

cards.flavor:
The vines coil around anything that enters their range.
Could there be anything lost here to help your mission?
cards.name: Garden of the Twining Vines
cards.text: Forced - When you would leave Garden of the Twining Vines, you must (choose two): - Place 1 of your clues on Garden of the Twining Vines. - Lose 1 action. - Lose 2 resources.

cards.flavor: Even from a distance, you observe the vines thrashing and roiling like a bucket of worms.  Be prepared for danger if you choose -- or are forced -- to enter.
cards.name: Garden of the Twining Vines

cards.flavor: Through a barricade of heaped glass rocks, a dim tunnel stretches through the mountains.  Only scattered shafts of light filtering through the glass illuminate your path.
cards.name: Black Pit
cards.text:
Each enemy at Black Pit gains aloof.
Each enemy ignores investigators at Black Pit while resolving the hunter keyword.

cards.flavor: The mountain range surrounding the mangaboo country seems to be made of colored glass, like enormous bottles.  Climbing a mountain of glass sounds too daunting of a prospect.  Is there any possible way through instead?
cards.name: Glass Mountains
cards.text: You cannot enter Glass Mountains unless the investigators have "dealt with the sorcerer" and "picked a new ruler."

cards.flavor: The invisible people of the valley tell you of the peach-like dama fruit, which can also turn you invisible temporarily.
cards.name: Invisible Valley
cards.text: [action]: Investigate. This test gets +2 difficulty. If you succeed, Invisible Bears cannot attack you during the enemy phase.

cards.flavor: Despite the apparent tranquility of the valley, the sounds of growling beasts echo around you.  A voice -- seemingly from nowhere -- warns you to beware of invisible bears!
cards.name: Invisible Valley
cards.text: Forced - When you enter Invisible Valley, if the other copy of Invisible Valley is unrevealed: Spawn the set-aside Invisible Bears next to the agenda deck.

cards.flavor: The invisible people of the valley tell you of herbs that allow you to walk on water when rubbed on your feet.
cards.name: Invisible Valley
cards.text: [action] [action]: Evade. This evasion attempt targets Invisible Bears and gets -2 difficulty.

cards.flavor: Despite the apparent tranquility of the valley, the sounds of growling beasts echo around you.  A voice -- seemingly from nowhere -- warns you to beware of invisible bears!
cards.name: Invisible Valley
cards.text: Forced - When you enter Invisible Valley, if the other copy of Invisible Valley is unrevealed: Spawn the set-aside Invisible Bears next to the agenda deck.

cards.flavor:
Your other enemies may agree that the vicious
invisible creatures are the greater threat here.
cards.name: Invisible Valley
cards.text: [action] If Invisible Bears are in play, choose a different enemy at your location: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (X), where X is the fight value the chosen enemy. If you succeed, that enemy disengages from you and gains aloof until the end of the round. During the enemy phase, deal Invisible Bears' damage to that enemy.

cards.flavor: Despite the apparent tranquility of the valley, the sounds of growling beasts echo around you.  A voice -- seemingly from nowhere -- warns you to beware of invisible bears!
cards.name: Invisible Valley
cards.text: Forced - When you enter Invisible Valley, if the other copy of Invisible Valley is unrevealed: Spawn the set-aside Invisible Bears next to the agenda deck.

cards.flavor: A strange man with long braided hair and beard greets you at the mouth of the cave.  You're astonished to find a human living here, but he doesn't act surprised at all.  You get no useful information out of the braided man, but he offers you a box filled with strange sounds, in exchange for a few of your things.
cards.name: First Landing
cards.text: [action] Discard an asset you control: Parley. Remember that you "traded for a box of clatters."

cards.flavor: Halfway up the enormous pyramid mountain, you spy a flat landing before a cave entrance.  You must investigate this once you have escaped the threats of the invisible valley.
cards.name: First Landing
cards.text: You cannot enter First Landing while Invisible Bears are in play.

cards.flavor: The landing overlooks a blanket of clouds.  Strange shapes flit in and out, though it's impossible to make out any features.  Through the few gaps in the cloud layer, you catch glimpses of a dark sea spewing jets of flame upward.  Just where is this place?!
cards.name: Second Landing
cards.text: [reaction] After you evade an enemy at Second Landing: Move it to a connecting location.

cards.flavor: The spiral steps disappear up into the cloud layer.  This may be your only path, but will it get you any closer to anywhere at all?
cards.name: Second Landing

cards.flavor: Moving as stealthily as you can, you find that the gargoyles sleep in shifts.  Interestingly, they remove their wooden wings while they rest, leaving them in plain sight.
cards.name: City of the Gargoyles
cards.text: [reaction] After you succeed at an [agility] test at this copy of City of the Gargoyles: Discover a clue from this location.

cards.flavor: Over the carved landscape, you sight the tall towers of a wooden city.  Surely this is the home of the gargoyles, but could this city hold a way for you to escape?
cards.name: City of the Gargoyles

cards.flavor: Not all of the gargoyles are competent fighters, and though they can't be beaten, you discover that you can steal the detachable wings off of the defeated ones.
cards.name: City of the Gargoyles
cards.text: [reaction] After you succeed at a [combat] test at this copy of City of the Gargoyles: Discover a clue from this location.

cards.flavor: Over the carved landscape, you sight the tall towers of a wooden city.  Surely this is the home of the gargoyles, but could this city hold a way for you to escape?
cards.name: City of the Gargoyles

cards.flavor: The very threat of sound is enough to intimidate some of the more skittish gargoyles.  Perhaps you can extort something from them... their wooden wings, perhaps?
cards.name: City of the Gargoyles
cards.text: [reaction] After you succeed at a [willpower] test at this copy of City of the Gargoyles: Discover a clue from this location.

cards.flavor: Over the carved landscape, you sight the tall towers of a wooden city.  Surely this is the home of the gargoyles, but could this city hold a way for you to escape?
cards.name: City of the Gargoyles

cards.flavor: With only one way forward, you rush out into the wooden landscape, sawdust scraping beneath your feet.  The silent gargoyles descend on you in a body, attempting to lay hands on you.
cards.name: Country of the Gargoyles
cards.text: Forced - After you discover any amount of clues from Country of the Gargoyles: Ready Gargoyles.

cards.flavor: The longer you wait, the more gargoyles assemble in the wooden country beyond.  Their carved faces don't show emotions, and they make no sound at all, but they clearly do not appreciate your presence.
cards.name: Country of the Gargoyles
cards.text: Forced - When you enter Country of the Gargoyles: Spawn the set-aside Gargoyles next to the agenda deck.

cards.flavor: The inside of the tower is utterly barren, but for a staircase down the center that leads to nothing.
cards.name: Prison Tower
cards.text: Investigators at Prison Tower cannot draw cards or gain resources during the upkeep phase.

cards.flavor: The gargoyles keep attempting to fly you up to the tallest tower in the city.  With how hostile they've been already, you can only guess that this acts as a prison.
cards.name: Prison Tower

cards.flavor: As their princess continues to blame you for the meteor's fall, the fickle people brandish thorny branches at you.  They speak of throwing you to the wild garden just outside town.
cards.name: Mangaboos
cards.text: Massive. Pervasive -- Each [[Land of the Mangaboos]] location. Mangaboos cannot make attacks of opportunity. Forced - When Mangaboos attacks you: Take 1 damage or move once toward Garden of the Twining Vines (you must choose one).

cards.flavor: What you can't see can't hurt you... you hope.
cards.name: Invisible Bears
cards.text: Massive. Pervasive -- Invisible Valley. Invisible Bears cannot make attacks of opportunity. While the investigators control fewer than 2[per_investigator] total clues as a group, Invisible Bears cannot be damaged.

cards.name: Gargoyles
cards.text: Massive. Pervasive -- Each [[Land of Naught]] location. Gargoyles cannot make attacks of opportunity during move actions or actions on encounter cards. Forced - After Gargoyles attack you: Move 1 location toward Prison Tower. If this effect occurred during an action, resolve this movement after the action has been resolved. [free] If you "traded for a box of clatters:" Gargoyles cannot attack you until the end of the round. (Limit once per game per investigator.)

cards.name: Building Fatigue
cards.text: Revelation - Put Building Fatigue into play in your threat area. Forced - After you leave a location: Add 1 resource to Building Fatigue (from the token bank). Forced - At the start of the round, lose 1 action for each resource on Building Fatigue. Discard Building Fatigue.

cards.flavor:
"We hope to grow to be dragons some day,
but just now we're only dragonettes."
<right>-- L. Frank Baum, Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
cards.name: Dragonette
cards.text: Retaliate. Forced - If Dragonette would be discarded via a scenario effect: Move it directly to any investigator's location. It engages and makes an immediate attack against that investigator.

cards.flavor:
"... and have a pedigree that I challenge any humans to equal, as it extends back about twenty thousand years,
to the time of the famous Green Dragon of Atlantis..."
<right>-- L. Frank Baum, Dorothy and the Wizard of Oz
cards.name: Green Dragon
cards.text:
Hunter.  Alert.
[reaction] When Green Dragon attacks you, discard an asset you control: Cancel that attack.

cards.flavor:
Careful preparation and steady footing are
your keys to success for the journey inland.
cards.name: Long Trek
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] or [agility] (3). If you fail by... - ...exactly 1, take 1 damage and lose 1 resource. - ...exactly 2, take 1 damage and lose 2 resources. - ...3 or more, take 2 damage and lose 2 resources.

cards.name: Deep Impact
cards.text: Easy / Standard [skull]: -X. X is equal to the number of [[Colour]] cards at your location (including your location). [cultist]: -2. If there is a card with Decay X at your location, discard a card from your hand at random. [tablet]: -1. If you fail, lose 1 resource for each point you fail by. [elder_thing]: -2. If you are at a [[Colour]] location, reveal another token.

cards.name: Deep Impact
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X.  X is equal to 1 + the number of [[Colour]] cards at your location (including your location).
[cultist]: -3.  Discard a card from your hand at random.
[tablet]: -3.  If you fail, lose 1 resource for each point you fail by.
[elder_thing]: -3.  If you are at a [[Colour]] location, reveal another token.

cards.flavor: The countryside is already showing strong signs of influence from the Colour.  The plants grow progressively more bright and vivid, but an aura of disease lingers in each trunk and stalk.  Best to finish your work quickly to minimize your exposure to the Colour.
cards.name: The Infection Begins
Here Comes Trouble
cards.text:
A distant roar suddenly echoes across the countryside. You turn to Dorothy and ask her if she recognizes the sound, and she gives a nervous nod. "I 'spect that one of our old enemies has gotten worked up from the Colour changin' things. You said it takes time for the Colour to affect people and things, so they might just be on a rampage of their own." You grimace, readying yourself to deal with the unwelcome complication to the mission.
Spawn the set-aside [[Nemesis]] enemy at the furthest location from all investigators.

cards.flavor: While the corruption is indeed spreading slowly, each minute you spend in the Colour's sphere of influence affects you more strongly.  Already you can feel yourself drained, as if part of you is being drawn into the discolored landscape.  How far are you willing to go for the sake of observation?
cards.name: Biohazard
Taken a Toll
cards.text:
You collapse to your knees with a ragged breath and try to steady yourself. The Gardners weren't affected this quickly when they were plagued by the Colour, were they? This doesn't bode well for your mission -- or your immediate well-being. You make the difficult decision to withdraw before anything worse begins to develop.
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (your choice).

cards.flavor: There's no question that the meteorite landed in this country.  There must be evidence somewhere to lead you to the impact site, it's just a matter of finding it as soon as possible.
cards.name: Scour the Countryside
cards.text: [free] Investigators spend 5[per_investigator] clues as a group: Put the set-aside Meteorite Crater into play. For each investigator in the Campaign Log who knows the Colour's destructive methods, reduce the clue requirement of this ability by 2. (Group limit once per game.) Objective - When an investigator enters Meteorite Crater, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Full Exposure
cards.text:
You follow the signs of upheaval and gather directions from the bewildered citizens of the country to a small clearing in the trees. The air shimmers with greater intensity as you approach the crater. This is what you had prepared for since the start. Several onlookers observe you from a safe distance, but one man approaches close behind you. He is short and stocky, with earth-toned clothes, with a thick beard down to his waist. His comical appearance is offset by the expression on his face. He clutches his temples with both hands, teeth gritted, but his eyes focused forward and glazed over. He pushes past you, and the glow from the meteorite flares brightly. One of your friends darts forward and pulls the little man back from the crater, and the glow dims back down. "Ruggedo, what happened?" they ask. The little man simply lies on the grass in a cold sweat, muttering about the earth, a strange poison, and dark whispers.
Choose a companion asset in play. In the Campaign Log under "Companions of Oz," mark 1 fatigue next to the chosen asset's name.

cards.flavor: At a glance, you can already tell that the meteorite here in Oz is far larger than the one that landed outside Arkham.  But this information is not enough.  Is the Colour being further fed by the strange land of Oz?  Take this brief window to observe as much of the Colour as you can before it grows too unsafe.
cards.name: Ground Zero
cards.text: Objective - If the investigators have "observed the meteorite's activity," you may advance. (You will still have a chance to advance the other act.)

cards.name: Inch by Inch
cards.text:
You can ill afford patience with the invasion being so advanced already, but knowledge wins wars. You make careful observations and compare to what you've seen in the surrounding countryside over the course of several hours. The results are daunting, but in line with your expectations.
If another act card is in play, the investigators may continue playing. Otherwise, proceed to ((→R2)).

cards.flavor: With each passing second, the color spreads and warps the country around it.  Now is the best time for observation.
cards.name: Meteorite Crater
cards.text: Decay 10 -- Remember that the investigators have "observed the meteorite's activity." (Remember this even if there are no investigators at this location.) [free] Investigators at Meteorite Crater spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Remove 1 horror from Meteorite Crater.

cards.flavor:
The pulsing glow of the Colour is brightest here.
Brace yourself for contact with the meteor.
cards.name: Meteorite Crater
Ambient Droning
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, put Ambient Droning into play in your threat area with X resources on it, where X is the amount you failed by. You get -1 to each of your skills. Forced - After you perform a skill test, remove 1 resource from Ambient Droning. If there are no resources on Ambient Droning, discard it.

cards.name: Discoloured Insects
cards.text: Spawn - Any empty location. Hunter. Aloof. Forced - After horror is removed from a card at Discoloured Insects's location with Decay X: Discoloured Insects attacks each investigator at its location.

cards.name: Meteorite Fragment
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Meteorite Fragment to the nearest location without a copy of Meteorite Fragment attached. The attached location gains the [[Colour]] trait. Forced - At the end of the round, deal 1 damage and 1 horror to each investigator at the attached location. [action]: Test [willpower] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, discard Meteorite Fragment.

cards.name: Surface Quake
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (4). If you fail, take 2 damage or lose 1 action (choose one). If you fail by 3 or more, you cannot move or be moved until the end of the round.

cards.name: Double Whammy
cards.text: Easy / Standard [skull]: -1. -3 instead if there is a [[Witch]] or [[Sorcerer]] enemy at your location. [cultist]: -2. If you fail, remove a horror from a card in play with Decay X. [tablet]: -2. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location. [elder_thing]: -2. If there is a [[Colour]] card at your location (including your location), discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Double Whammy
cards.text: Hard / Expert [skull]: -2. -4 instead if there is a [[Witch]] or [[Sorcerer]] enemy at your location. [cultist]: -3. Remove a horror from a card in play with Decay X. [tablet]: -3. Place 1 of your clues on your location. [elder_thing]: -3. Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

cards.flavor: You can't begin to break down just how foolish the witches' plan is to control the Colour, but they likely won't listen to reason if they're willing to go this far for revenge.  What's more, with the witches agitating the spreading Colour, the alien substance is lashing out more strongly against anything that comes near it.  Ozma wishes safety and good fortune as you set out from the city once again.
cards.name: Insurrection
Coming in Hot
cards.text:
With you distracted and the countryside in an uproar already, another of the old enemies of Oz has appeared, no doubt also stirred up by the Colour. You'd appreciate if this half-baked revenge plot could wait its turn while you sort out the witches' one first, but alas.
Spawn the set-aside [[Nemesis]] enemy at any empty location.

cards.flavor: The witches' meddling is causing the Colour to behave more erratically.  If you don't put a stop to their project in short order, then everything is set to boil over catastrophically.
cards.name: Controlled Chaos
Spells Defeat
cards.text:
All around you, fragments of the Colour erupt from the ground, arcing like breaching whales and scoring the terrain wherever it touches. You make a mad dash back to the Emerald City, dodging the lethal strands as you go.
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (your choice).

cards.flavor: Your main priority is to locate Mombi and bring her scheme to an end.  To that end, you must find and interrogate the senior witches -- a task which may be easier if you know about the formative stages of the Colour.
cards.name: Toil and Trouble
cards.text: [free] Investigators spend 2[per_investigator] clues as a group: Spawn a set-aside Saturated Witch at your location. For each investigator in the Campaign Log who knows the Colour's physical limitations, reduce the clue requirement of this ability by 1. Objective - If there are 3 copies of Saturated Witch in the victory display, you may advance.

cards.name: Step Into the Circle
cards.text:
Whether by force or by reason, you are finally able to determine where Mombi is focusing the witches' power. Owing to the power she once held in the days before Ozma's ascension to the throne, the witches still have great respect for the old crone. If you can outmatch Mombi herself, the other witches will likely abandon this plot.
Put the set-aside Coven Hideout into play. Spawn the set-aside Mombi at Coven Hideout.

cards.flavor: Mombi may have lost her former power, but she's still a cunning foe.  With the Colour flowing through her, she will be a dangerous enemy to confront.
cards.name: The Colour of Magic
cards.text: Objective - If Mombi is defeated, you must immediately advance. (You will still have a chance to advance the other act.)

cards.name: Detoxification
cards.text:
Your attacks cut through the empowered witch, until at last she collapses back, too weak to continue channeling the Colour. "No! My revenge...!" she rasps, digging her long fingers into the discolored dirt. You half-pity the old woman for her obsession, but this horrid plan is only speeding the destruction of the whole world along. If not for your intervention, she wouldn't have lived more than a few minutes beyond her revenge... though from the look on Mombi's face, she might not have cared.
If another act card is in play, the investigators may continue playing. Otherwise, proceed to ((→R2)).

cards.flavor:
Colour flows through the assembled witches,
linking them in a horrid chain of light.
cards.name: Coven Hideout
cards.text:
Mombi gets +1 fight for every 1[per_investigator] clues on Coven Hideout.
[free] During an attack or evasion attempt against Mombi, spend 2 clues: Ignore the forced effect on Mombi for this attack.

cards.flavor: The unearthly glow shines most strongly from this patch of woods.  Whoever is first to enter will likely take a great amount of strain.
cards.name: Coven Hideout
cards.text: Forced - When an investigator enters Coven Hideout, the investigators must decide (choose one): - Each investigator suffers 1 physical or mental trauma (choose one). - In the Campaign Log under "Companions of Oz," mark 1 fatigue next to the name of each companion asset in play.

cards.flavor: Colour flows through the hag.  Can it be severed?
cards.name: Saturated Witch
cards.text: Retaliate. [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (2). This test gets +1[per_investigator] difficulty. If you succeed, move Saturated Witch to the victory display. If you fail, Saturated Witch attacks you.

cards.name: Mombi
cards.text: Forced - When you would reveal a chaos token during an attack or evasion attempt against Mombi: Instead, reveal tokens until an [elder_sign], [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token is revealed. For every 2 tokens revealed, take 1 damage or 1 horror. Cancel each non-symbol token revealed. (Limit once per test.)

cards.name: Devious Warlock
cards.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], or [auto_fail] token is revealed during a test at Devious Warlock's location: Remove 1 horror from any card in play with Decay X.

cards.name: Infused Magic
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Infused Magic to a non-[[Elite]] enemy without a copy of Infused Magic attached. If you cannot attach Infused Magic to an enemy, it gains surge. Attached enemy gains the [[Colour]] trait and gets +1 fight. Forced - After the attached enemy is evaded: Discard Infused Magic.

cards.name: Sculpted Colour
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Sculpted Colour to the nearest location without a copy of Sculpted Colour attached. Forced - At the end of the round, if there are 1 or more [[Colour]] enemies at the attached location, place a doom on one of those enemies. [action]: Test [willpower] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, discard Sculpted Colour.

cards.name: Chasing Rainbows
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1.  -3 instead if Localized Storm is attached to your location or a connecting location.
[cultist]: -2.  If you fail, shuffle a [[Colour]] card in the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -2.  If you fail, all damage and horror taken while resolving the effects of this test is considered to be direct.
[elder_thing]: -2.  If you fail, move a [[Colour]] enemy in play according to its hunter or patrol keyword.

cards.name: Chasing Rainbows
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2.  -4 instead if Localized Storm is attached to your location or a connecting location.
[cultist]: -3.  Shuffle a [[Colour]] card in the encounter discard pile back into the encounter deck.
[tablet]: -3.  All damage and horror taken while resolving the effects of this test is considered to be direct.
[elder_thing]: -3.  Move a [[Colour]] enemy in play according to its hunter or patrol keyword.

cards.flavor: As you step outside the gates of the Emerald City, you are reminded that it is one of the few places left in Oz where the Colour has not rapidly spread to, thanks to the magic of Ozma and Glinda.  The painfully vibrant infection has already advanced to its second stage of gray wasting, but it remains deadly.  Proceed into the countryside with caution.
cards.name: Fading Fast
Decadent Behavior
cards.text:
A new threat emerges, pushed to madness once more by the Colour. Through the haze of madness and the crumbling landscape, they still seek to settle their old scores, perhaps as a final act of their right mind. Once again it falls to you to stop this malefactor.
Spawn the set-aside [[Nemesis]] enemy at any location connected to the lead investigator's location.

cards.flavor: Each minute you spend in the degrading countryside is a risk to your health and sanity.  Do not tarry any longer than you have to, regardless of the missions, for without you, Oz is surely doomed.
cards.name: Bleached Away
Land's End
cards.text:
The storm that had been steadily flowing through the land slowly dissipates. Within minutes, any moisture left by the rains -- and even the humidity in the air -- is drained away by the leeching Colour. There is no end to the hunger and thirst of the Colour as it grows and multiplies. You retreat back to the Emerald City at once, resisting the gnawing force each step of the way.
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (your choice).

cards.flavor: The color of the countryside -- faded as it now is -- was unmistakable from your glimpse in the magic picture.  You have to find and pursue the storm in hopes that Polychrome lies somewhere in its wake.
cards.name: Somewhere Over the Rainbow
cards.text: [free] If there are 2[per_investigator] or more locations with damage on them: Put the set-aside Isolated Peak location into play. For each investigator in the Campaign Log who knows the Colour's full spectroscopic analysis, reduce the required number of locations by 1. Objective - If After the Rains is attached to Isolated Peak, advance.

cards.name: High and Dry
cards.text:
The storm finally veers away from its usual circuit toward a tall mountain peak. You give it a passing glance, but see the bright shimmer of rainbow colors as the storm passes. Hopeful, you stare more carefully, and spot a shimmer of prismatic light lingering about the mountaintop. This is no sudden burst of the invasive Colour. Polychrome must be up there!
Remove After the Rains from the game. Reveal Isolated Peak and put the set-aside Polychrome story asset into play at Isolated Peak.

cards.flavor: Polychrome may be in sight, but several dangerous obstacles still lie between you and her.  The mountain peak is affected by the Colour, as is the rest of the landscape, and will take some careful planning to safely scale the cliffs both up and back down again.
cards.name: Mounting a Rescue
cards.text: Objective - If an investigator takes control of Polychrome, you must immediately advance. (You will still have a chance to advance the other act.)

cards.name: The Rainbow's Daughter
cards.text:
You and your companions forge a way up the rock face, finally reaching the top to find Polychrome, as you hoped. The colorful fairy sways and twirls in place in a form of dance while tears trickle down her cheeks. Dorothy breathes a thankful sigh as she clambers up alongside you. "I'm glad Polly's alright. She may seem odd, but dancin' is just her way of distractin' herself from her troubles." You approach the distraught fairy, and she immediately lights up at the sight of many of her former friends. She runs to embrace them -- though keeps a wary distance from you as a stranger. "Everyone! However did you find me?" she asks in a voice as light as air. Dorothy and your other companions tell her of your dedication in tracking the storm, and Polly turns to you to give an elegant curtsy. "I'm very grateful! I was afraid I would be trapped here. But has the land here always been this... sick?" There is plenty to explain, but there will be opportunity for that in much safer places.
If another act card is in play, the investigators may continue playing. Otherwise, proceed to ((→R2)).

cards.name: Isolated Peak
cards.text: While Polychrome is not controlled by an investigator, she gains "[free]: Take control of Polychrome.  For the remainder of the scenario, Polychrome does not take up any slots.  Then, investigators at Isolated Peak may spend up to 4[per_investigator] clues as a group.  For every 1[per_investigator] clues you do not spend, choose a different companion asset in play.  In the Campaign Log under "Companions of Oz," mark 1 fatigue next to the chosen asset's name."

cards.flavor:
This lonely mountain stretches up to the clouds,
piercing even the roaming storm.
cards.name: Isolated Peak
cards.text: Investigators cannot enter Isolated Peak.

cards.flavor: Polly is your closest chance of fighting fire with fire.
cards.name: Polychrome
cards.text:
You get +1 skill value during tests printed on or performed against cards with the [[Colour]] trait.
[reaction] After a [[Colour]] card at your location is defeated or discarded, exhaust Polychrome: Move to a connecting location.

cards.flavor: Could Polychrome be here?
cards.name: After the Rains
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, attach After the Rains to the location with Localized Storm attached to it. [free] If there is no damage on the attached location, investigators at that location spend 2 clues as a group: Place 1 damage on the attached location. Any investigator at that location may activate this ability.

cards.name: Localized Storm
cards.text: Localized Storm cannot be discarded or removed from play. Forced - At the start of the mythos phase, attach Localized Storm to the connecting location with the fewest investigators. [free] Place 1[per_investigator] clues on the attached location as a group: Resolve the forced effect on After the Rains as if it were the end of the round. Then, resolve the forced effect on Localized Storm as if it were the start of the mythos phase.

cards.flavor: The citizens of Oz who haven't fled to the Emerald City are powerless to act for themselves.
cards.name: Colourful Thrall
cards.text: Spawn - Location with Localized Storm attached. Location with Localized Storm attached. Forced - At the end of the round: Place 1 doom on Colourful Thrall.

cards.name: High Winds
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Immediately resolve the forced effect on After the Rains as if it were the end of the round. Then, resolve the forced effect on Localized Storm as if it were the start of the mythos phase.

cards.flavor:
The stone, magnetic as it had been, must have had some peculiar electrical property; for it had "drawn the lightning"...
-- H.P. Lovecraft, The Colour Out of Space
cards.name: Lightning Burst
cards.text: Revelation - Test [agility] (6). This test gets -1 difficulty for each connection away Localized Storm is from you. If you fail, take 1 damage and lose an action.

cards.flavor:
Even the weather is not immune to
the influence of the Colour.
cards.name: Tinted Rain
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (6). This test gets -1 difficulty for each connection away Localized Storm is from you. If you fail, take 1 horror and place 1 of your clues on your location.

cards.name: Misery Loves Company
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -1.  -3 instead if there is damage on your location.
[cultist]: -2.  If you fail, heal 1 damage from any enemy in play.
[tablet]: -1.  Discard a non-weakness card committed to this test.
[elder_thing]: -3.  If you fail and there is no damage on your location, place a damage on your location.

cards.name: Misery Loves Company
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -2.  -4 instead if there is damage on your location.
[cultist]: -3.  Heal 1 damage from any enemy in play.
[tablet]: -2.  Discard a non-weakness card committed to this test.
[elder_thing]: -4.  If there is no damage on your location, place a damage on your location.

cards.flavor: The many foes of Oz have banded together in spite of the threat of the Colour to target you and your friends.  Getting them to see reason is out of the question, and seeing as the people of Oz are a peaceful lot, the brunt of fighting falls to you once again.
cards.name: United by Hatred
What's One More?
cards.text:
Through the cracked and desolate landscape comes one final antagonist. With the gray and decadent nature of the entire area, this foe is able to creep up nearly upon you before you notice their approach.
Spawn the set-aside [[Nemesis]] enemy at the lead investigator's location.

cards.flavor: Between the invaders and the Colour, war is surely hell.  You must bring it to an end before any serious harm befalls you and your companions, or perhaps worse yet, if the invaders are able to assault the Emerald City.
cards.name: No Man's Land
Siege Tactics
cards.text:
The enemy are able to rally into one cohesive body and trample you in their rush to assault the Emerald City. You are battered and assailed as the troops chant the unknown language of the Colour, continuing their mad attacks as long as the influence of the Colour allows them to focus.
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (your choice).

cards.flavor: You have to stop the flow of powerful enemies arriving by the wave, but where did they breach into Oz?
cards.name: The Enemies of Oz
cards.text: Each pervasive enemy gets -2 health for each investigator in the Campaign Log who knows the Colour's mental influence. [action] Spend 1-3 clues: For each clue spent, deal 1 damage to an enemy at your location. This ability does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Objective - If The Phanfasms are defeated, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Break Through the Line
cards.text:
As you vanquish the foes in series, you are gradually able to pinpoint their base of operations. Deep in the heart of the country, you spy the tunnel that Woot mentioned earlier, heavily guarded by Nome soldiers.
Put the set-aside Tunnel Entrance into play. Place 1 damage on Tunnel Entrance. Spawn the set-aside General Guph at Tunnel Entrance.

cards.flavor: From a distance, you see one seasoned Nome directing the troops toward the Emerald City.  Something strange strikes you about this Nome, however, as there seems to be a stronger glint of cognizance in his eyes than in the other foes you have fought.  He is the lynch pin of this battle.
cards.name: Strategic Target
cards.text: Objective - If General Guph enters the victory display, advance. (You will still have a chance to advance the other act.)

cards.name: Command and Conquer
cards.text:
If you defeated General Guph:
The old Nome collapses down with a groan, unable to continue the fight as you stand above him triumphantly. "So be it," he growls, "a warrior must be prepared for defeat. But I do so of my own volition, not for a mad king!"
If you parleyed with General Guph:
The surly old Nome sets his axe down with an irritated sigh. "Leave it to the people of Oz to try things the peaceful way. No matter, I suppose it is better than fighting for lunacy."
In either case:
If another act card is in play, the investigators may continue playing. Otherwise, proceed to ((→R2)).

cards.flavor: The Nomes are the ones who dug this tunnel, so it's natural that you could learn by observing them.
cards.name: Tunnel Entrance
cards.text: Tunnel Entrance gets -2 shroud value for each exhausted [[Nome]] enemy at this location.

cards.flavor:
The Nomes are the last remaining invaders, but they
cluster together fiercely at the entrance to their tunnel.
cards.name: Tunnel Entrance
cards.text: Forced - When an investigator enters Tunnel Entrance, the investigators must decide (choose one): - Each investigator suffers 1 physical or mental trauma (choose one). - In the Campaign Log under "Companions of Oz," mark 1 fatigue next to the name of each companion asset in play.

cards.flavor:
"They had large, strong bodies, but heads so small that they were no bigger than door-knobs... they wore big heads, made of pasteboard, which they fastened over their own little heads."
-- The Emerald City of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: The Whimsies
cards.text: Massive. Pervasive -- Each location with damage. Forced - When The Whimsies are defeated: Put the set-aside The Growleywogs into play next to the agenda deck. Place 1 damage on any location without damage.

cards.flavor:
"Their powerful muscles lay just underneath their skins, like bunches of tough rope, and the weakest Growleywog was so strong that he could pick up an elephant and toss it seven miles away."
-- The Emerald City of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: The Growleywogs
cards.text: Massive. Pervasive -- Each location with damage. Forced - When The Growleywogs are defeated: Put the set-aside The Phanfasms into play next to the agenda deck. Place 1 damage on any location without damage.

cards.flavor:
"...from all the rocky huts on the mountain-top came flocking a horde of Phanfasms, all with hairy bodies, but wearing heads of various animals, birds and reptiles. All were ferocious and repulsive-looking to the deceived eyes of the Nome, and Guph could not repress a shudder of disgust as he looked upon them."
-- The Emerald City of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: The Phanfasms
cards.text: Massive. Pervasive -- Each location with damage.

cards.name: General Guph
cards.text: Forced - When you would deal any amount of damage to General Guph: Reduce that damage by 1 (to a minimum of 1). An investigator at General Guph's location may spend 1 clue to ignore this effect. [action] Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (4). If you succeed, place 1 resource on General Guph. Then, if there are 1[per_investigator] resources on General Guph, move him to the victory display.

cards.name: Bolstered Growth
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Bolstered Growth to an enemy in play. Attached enemy gets +1 health. Forced - When the attached enemy would be defeated: Discard a non-story asset controlled by an investigator at the attached enemy's location. [action]: Test [willpower] or [agility] (2). This test gets +2 difficulty if the attached enemy is ready. If you succeed, discard Bolstered Growth. This action does not provoke attacks of opportunity

cards.name: Driven Assault
cards.text: Forced - Test [willpower] or [agility] (3). This test gets +1 difficulty and gains peril if there is damage at your location. For each point you fail by, take 1 damage or 1 horror (choose one).

cards.name: Mindless Hatred
cards.text: Revelation - Put Mindless Hatred into play next to the agenda deck. Each [[Humanoid]] enemy at a location with damage on it gains retaliate and gets +1 damage. Forced - At the end of the round, discard Mindless Hatred. (Max once per round.)

cards.name: Hall of the Mountain King
cards.text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: -X.  X is equal to the number of connections you are from Tunnel's End.
[cultist]: -2.  -4 instead there is a [[Nome]] enemy at your location.
[tablet]: -2.  -4 instead if you are investigating.
[elder_thing]: -3.  If you fail by 2 or more, take 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.name: Hall of the Mountain King
cards.text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: -X.  X is equal to 1 + the number of connections you are from Tunnel's End.
[cultist]: -3.  -5 instead there is a [[Nome]] enemy at your location.
[tablet]: -3.  -5 instead if you are investigating.
[elder_thing]: -4.  If you fail, take 1 damage and 1 horror.

cards.flavor: The tunnel dead-ends in a large cavern with several branching paths.  The slow but steady marching of metal boots echoes all around, impossible to pinpoint in these twisted caves.
cards.name: Covert Operations
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, perform the following steps in order: - Shuffle the Active Army Patrol card back into the Army Patrol Deck. - Move the Next Army Patrol card into the Active position. - Draw the top card of the Army Patrol Deck and put it in the Next position.

cards.name: The Iron Giant
cards.text:
As you progress through the Nome Kingdom, a much heavier metallic thumping draws steadily closer until an enormous figure lurches into view. A mechanical man of iron, much like Tik-Tok, stomps forward, lashing out at random with its enormous iron hammer. The telltale glow of the Colour seeps from its head and joints, making it no secret why the giant is rampaging.
Spawn the set-aside Iron Giant at any location where the Nome Army is not currently at.

cards.flavor: Danger mounts, but your mission remains the same as it ever was.  The minions of the Nome King continue their tireless march, always in search of enemies to expunge.
cards.name: The War Machine
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, perform the following steps in order: - Shuffle the Active Army Patrol card back into the Army Patrol Deck. - Move the Next Army Patrol card into the Active position. - Draw the top card of the Army Patrol Deck and put it in the Next position.

cards.name: Run a Distraction
cards.text:
All at once, the Nome soldiers suddenly change course and converge on you. One of your companions leaps into action without hesitation, leading the army away from the others. You wait tensely for several minutes until your companion finally returns, looking a bit more ragged than before.
Choose a companion asset in play. In the Campaign Log under "Companions of Oz," mark 1 fatigue next to the chosen asset's name.

cards.flavor: A strong rumble nearly unbalances you, giving clear signs that the army's path wasn't the only thing shifting.  Finish quickly, or these caves may be your tomb.
cards.name: Fault Line
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, perform the following steps in order: - Shuffle the Active Army Patrol card back into the Army Patrol Deck. - Move the Next Army Patrol card into the Active position. - Draw the top card of the Army Patrol Deck and put it in the Next position.

cards.name: Rocks Fall
cards.text:
The entire kingdom shakes wildly, and cascading rocks buffet you while the radiating Colour wracks your mind. With death as the only certainty in the underground, you flee back to the tunnel with all possible speed.
Each investigator who has not resigned is defeated and suffers a physical or mental trauma (choose one).

cards.flavor: Though you never saw them untainted, the caverns appear warped, and glow faintly with the sickly light of the Colour.  You must traverse the outer most part of the kingdom and find a passage further inward.
cards.name: Journey to the Center
cards.text: As an additional cost to enter an Inner Kingdom location, investigators must spend 4[per_investigator] clues as a group. Objective - When an investigator enters an Inner Kingdom location, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Onward and Downward
cards.text: The tunnels and caverns recur on themselves endlessly, but you gradually map them out and find unexplored branches that lead further inward. The horrid influence of the Colour proves to be a beacon of sorts, as it strengthens the closer you venture to the center of the kingdom.

cards.flavor: The carved structures of the Nome Kingdom grow more densely packed and more refined as you approach its heart, but the Colour drones strongly all around you.  You must reach the throne room, and quickly.
cards.name: Lower Echelons
cards.text: As an additional cost to enter Royal Audience Chamber, investigators must spend 4[per_investigator] clues as a group. Objective - When an investigator enters Royal Audience Chamber, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Audience Granted
cards.text:
At last, you stand before the stone doors of the Nome King's throne room. Your companions rally to help you push, and with a harsh grinding, you set your eyes on Ruggedo. The Nome sits writhing in his reclaimed throne, raised on a dais in the center of the room. His maddened wailing is joined by that of Kaliko, his former replacement, who lies curled by a golden gong, clutching his head. You step forward cautiously, and the Nome King's eyes immediately snap to you. Long tendrils of Colour lash out from his body, and Ruggedo's wailing grows in pitch, mixed with stilted words. "It burns... and freezes... my mind is... brittle... but melting... make it... end!"
Spawn the set-aside Ruggedo at Royal Audience Chamber.

cards.flavor: Is the heart of the Colour still with Ruggedo?  You must beat back the alien presence as you try to purge all influence from the Nome King's mind and body.  The question is... how far must you go to ensure that Ruggedo survives the ordeal?
cards.name: Regicide
cards.text: Objective - If there is 6 or more horror on Ruggedo, you may advance. Objective - If there is 8 or more horror on Ruggedo, you may advance.

cards.name: Banishment
cards.text:
You channel your knowledge of the Colour gleaned from your adventures in Oz to excise the alien thing from Ruggedo, driving it like worms from the earth out of the maddened monarch. The audience chamber goes dim as the unearthly glow fades, and you face Ruggedo, slumped on his throne in a wretched state.
If there is fewer than 8 horror on Ruggedo, ((→R2)). Otherwise, ((→R3)).

cards.flavor: The Nomes have left the tunnel unguarded, perhaps due to overconfidence, the growing madness, or both.
cards.name: Tunnel's End
cards.text: [action]: Resign. You retreat back to Oz before the corrupted Nomes can catch up with you.

cards.flavor: You reach the end -- or the start, rather -- of the tunnel that the invading Nomes dug to reach Oz.  This side of the tunnel is far more precisely cut than the other, speaking of the mental degradation the miners suffered as they worked.
cards.name: Tunnel's End

cards.flavor: The walls of the throne room pulse with the horrid Colour.  Is there some rhythm or pattern to the undulations?
cards.name: Royal Audience Chamber
cards.text: [free] If there are no clues on Royal Audience Chamber: Add 1[per_investigator] clues to Royal Audience Chamber and place 1 horror on Ruggedo.

cards.flavor: The very heart of the Nome Kingdom, carved exquisitely to satisfy the whims of its lord.  The closer you draw, the more strongly you can feel the presence of the Colour.
cards.name: Royal Audience Chamber

cards.flavor: The secrets of the armory may lie in its stock of equipment.
cards.name: Inner Kingdom
cards.text: [free] During your turn, exhaust any number of [[Item]] assets you control: This location gets -1 shroud for each asset exhausted until the end of your turn (minimum 1).

cards.flavor: The central parts of the kingdom are where the king and his favored minions reside.  As such, everything is higher quality, from the furniture and decorations to the stonework itself.
cards.name: Inner Kingdom

cards.flavor: The officers have long abandoned their plans, but you may still find insight into how to fight the Nomes here.
cards.name: Inner Kingdom
cards.text: While there are no clues on this location, non-[[Elite]] enemies at this location get -1 evade while ready and -1 fight while exhausted.

cards.flavor: The central parts of the kingdom are where the king and his favored minions reside.  As such, everything is higher quality, from the furniture and decorations to the stonework itself.
cards.name: Inner Kingdom

cards.flavor:
Only the greatest warriors among the Nome ranks are allowed within this hall, and though they are corrupted
by the Colour, their quality is still a cut above.
cards.name: Inner Kingdom
cards.text: Each non-[[Elite Nome]] enemy at this location gains Elite.

cards.flavor: The central parts of the kingdom are where the king and his favored minions reside.  As such, everything is higher quality, from the furniture and decorations to the stonework itself.
cards.name: Inner Kingdom

cards.flavor:
Games of quoits and ninepins lie unused about the hall, but the maddened Nomes who would be playing them
are still itching for a fight.
cards.name: Inner Kingdom
cards.text: Each non-[[Elite Nome]] enemy at this location gains retaliate.

cards.flavor: The central parts of the kingdom are where the king and his favored minions reside.  As such, everything is higher quality, from the furniture and decorations to the stonework itself.
cards.name: Inner Kingdom

cards.flavor: The open rooms are heaped with jewelry and trinkets of all shapes and sizes, set with gems and richly filigreed.
cards.name: Inner Kingdom
cards.text: While there are no clues on this location, investigators at this location gain an additional resource during the upkeep phase.

cards.flavor: The central parts of the kingdom are where the king and his favored minions reside.  As such, everything is higher quality, from the furniture and decorations to the stonework itself.
cards.name: Inner Kingdom

cards.flavor: The most lavishly decorated rooms are for the king, his favored servants, and any guests, willing or not.
cards.name: Inner Kingdom
cards.text: While you are investigating this location, it gets -2 shroud during your last action of your turn.

cards.flavor: The central parts of the kingdom are where the king and his favored minions reside.  As such, everything is higher quality, from the furniture and decorations to the stonework itself.
cards.name: Inner Kingdom

cards.flavor: If you can figure out how to work the Nomes' magical forges, you may be able to better equip yourselves.
cards.name: Outer Kingdom
cards.text: While there are no clues on this location, reduce the cost of each [[Weapon]] asset played at this location by 1.

cards.flavor: The network of caverns and tunnels that make up the outer domain of the Nome Kingdom are large and open enough to traverse without getting lost.
cards.name: Outer Kingdom

cards.flavor:
Careful observation of the sleeping Nomes may give
some better insight in navigating the barracks.
cards.name: Outer Kingdom
cards.text: While there is a [[Nome]] enemy at this location, it gets -2 shroud value.

cards.flavor: The network of caverns and tunnels that make up the outer domain of the Nome Kingdom are large and open enough to traverse without getting lost.
cards.name: Outer Kingdom

cards.flavor: Though half-crazed by the Colour, the marching soldiers here are more vigilant as they go through the paces of their former routines.
cards.name: Outer Kingdom
cards.text: Each non-[[Elite Nome]] enemy at this location gains alert.

cards.flavor: The network of caverns and tunnels that make up the outer domain of the Nome Kingdom are large and open enough to traverse without getting lost.
cards.name: Outer Kingdom

cards.flavor: The Nomes eat refined earth in various forms, and the ones found here will have just eaten and be especially hardy.
cards.name: Outer Kingdom
cards.text: Each non-[[Elite Nome]] enemy at this location gets +1 health.

cards.flavor: The network of caverns and tunnels that make up the outer domain of the Nome Kingdom are large and open enough to traverse without getting lost.
cards.name: Outer Kingdom

cards.flavor:
Quality is the order of the day in these workshops,
and only the finest will find comparison here.
cards.name: Outer Kingdom
cards.text: While you are investigating this location, it gets -1 shroud for each asset you control with 4 or higher cost (to a minimum of 1 shroud).

cards.flavor: The network of caverns and tunnels that make up the outer domain of the Nome Kingdom are large and open enough to traverse without getting lost.
cards.name: Outer Kingdom

cards.flavor: The artificial forest has many places to hide, some even unknown to the Nomes in their maddened state.
cards.name: Outer Kingdom
cards.text: While there are no clues on this location, each non-[[Elite]] enemy at this location gains aloof.

cards.flavor: The network of caverns and tunnels that make up the outer domain of the Nome Kingdom are large and open enough to traverse without getting lost.
cards.name: Outer Kingdom
Billina's Eggs
cards.text: [free] Remove Billina's Eggs from the game: Evade. If you are evading a [[Nome]] enemy, this test automatically succeeds. Forced - If Billina's Eggs would leave play: Remove them from the game.

cards.name: Army Patrol
cards.text: Hard / Expert

cards.name: Army Patrol
cards.text: Hard / Expert

cards.name: Army Patrol
cards.text: Hard / Expert

cards.name: Army Patrol
cards.text: Hard / Expert

cards.flavor: The iron man hammers ceaselessly and indiscriminately, but the Colour is not an invader it can repel.
cards.name: Iron Giant
cards.text: Massive. Alert. Forced - At the start of the round, if Iron Giant is not engaged with any investigators: Move it once toward the nearest investigator. Iron Giant gets +2 evade until the end of the round.

cards.name: Ruggedo
cards.text: Decay 3 -- ((→R2)) While Ruggedo has 2 or more horror on him, he gains Retaliate. While Ruggedo has 4 or more horror on him, he gains Alert. [free] Remove 2[per_investigator] damage from Ruggedo: Ready Ruggedo and place 1 horror on him.

cards.text:
Easy / Standard

[tablet]: -2.  Cancel the effects (but not the icons) of each skill committed to this test.

Hard / Expert

cards.flavor: This is it.  The final stand against the Colour.  Whether or not you'll ever find a way to expel it from Earth depends on you surviving these next vital hours and preserving the Emerald City.
cards.name: Besieged
cards.text: Forced - When doom would be placed on this agenda: Instead, place 1 doom on any [[Intact]] location (with 1 doom on it, if possible). Then, if there is 2 or more doom on that location, flip it. Forced - At the end of the round, if there is 1 or more doom among cards you control: Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, move 1 doom from a card you control to this agenda. Forced - If there are no [[Intact]] locations in play, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Melting, Melting
cards.text:
Steadily and inevitably, the intangible Colour sweeps over the Emerald City, infecting and warping it, draining it of all life. Try as you might, the last bastions of the city crumble, and the Colour spreads over it like spilled ink.
((→R1))

cards.flavor: While the majority of your companions look to defend the surviving citizens, you and your chosen retinue must focus on repelling the Colour.  You must leverage every advantage you've earned from your time in Oz.  Now is the time to discover just what, if anything, can oppose the Colour.
cards.name: Colour Theory
cards.text: Check the Campaign Log.  For every 2 entries listed under "Advantages," reduce the clue requirement for this act by 1[per_investigator].

cards.name: The Light Fantastic
cards.text: You apply the knowledge and tools you've gathered to the daunting task as best you can. The core mass of the Colour is more resilient than the splotches and remnants that have thrived on the surface until now. But as the mass advances, it seems to take more time surrounding and infecting the city's emeralds than the rest of its material. It dawns on you that color is light, and for something that is a color in itself, the distortion of light through a gem is like a weak prism, affecting it in a way. No earthly prism could be enough to dissolve the Colour, but Oz is hardly an earthly place. You scour the city for the purest of emeralds and call on assistance from Ozma and Glinda to imbue them with the fairy magic of Oz. Cautiously, you approach an infected section of city and hold the prism up to the light. With some careful manipulation, the refracted light begins to sear into the Colour, causing it to recoil like burnt foliage. The prism is slow and ever-shifting, but without a doubt having a strong effect.

cards.flavor: With some creative application, the imbued prisms can actually drive the Colour out of its victims.  Expel the invading entity from the Emerald City before the city falls!
cards.name: Change of Colours
cards.text: [action] If you are at a [[Colour]] location: Test any skill (2). This test gets +2[per_investigator] difficulty and is considered to be a test on a [[Colour]] card for the purposes of other game effects. Investigators at your location may spend up to 1[per_investigator] clues as a group to reduce this test's difficulty by 2 for each clue spent. If you succeed, remove 1 doom from your location. If you succeed by 2 or more, remove 1 additional doom from your location or a connecting [[Colour]] location. Objective - If there is 2 or fewer total doom among all locations in play, advance.

cards.name: The Best Defense
cards.text:
Carefully, but with as much haste as you can manage, your purgation of the Colour finally causes it to recoil entirely. It leeches away back outside the city walls, conglomerating far out in the blasted landscape.
If there are 2 or fewer [[Intact]] locations in play, ((→R2)). Otherwise, ((→R3)).

cards.flavor: Many of the survivors collect in the royal palace, perhaps the furthest spot from danger for the time being.  On the wall near the entrance to the throne room, the stuffed head of a gump frowns down in disapproval of the chaos.
cards.name: Royal Palace of Oz
cards.text: [action]: Search the top 9 cards of your deck for an [[Oz]] asset and draw it.  Shuffle your deck.  (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
The brilliant gems of the palace dim and grow brittle
as the Colour saturates the palace.

cards.flavor: Pulses of light and energy emanate from the Colour as it rebuilds its strength for another assault.  The clock is ticking.
cards.name: Festering Parasite
cards.text: Forced - When doom would be placed on this agenda: Instead, place 1 doom on The Colour Out of Space Forced - At the end of the round, if there is 1 or more doom among cards you control: Test [willpower] (4). If you fail, move 1 doom from a card you control to this agenda. Forced - If there is 14 or more doom on The Colour Out of Space: Immediately advance this agenda.

cards.name: Explosive Colour
cards.text:
If it is act 1 or act 2:
With each shift and pulse, the Colour burgeons with alien energy, until at last it sweeps out with a fantastic nova. The vibrant shockwave penetrates all, even the magical barrier protecting the Emerald City. All hope of survival is lost in its wake.
((→R1)) Otherwise:
The destabilizing Colour wildly fluxes, rocketing up and around with reckless abandon. Your flight to the safety of the Emerald City is cut short as the searing cold energy of the Colour washes over you, flooding your senses.
((→R2))

cards.flavor: The Colour must be ejected at all costs.  You must be absolutely sure that no part of the Colour remains, and so your task begins with corralling the alien thing.
cards.name: Containment
cards.text: Doom cannot be removed from locations. [action]: Test any skill (2). This test gets +2 difficulty for each clue on your location and is considered to be a test on a [[Colour]] card for the purposes of other game effects. If you succeed, move 1 doom from your location to a connecting location. Objective - When an investigator enters Heart of the Infection, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Final Confrontation
cards.text:
Slowly but surely, the enchanted emerald prisms drive the Colour from the blanched woods to a single spot. The entity conglomerates once more in a shifting mass, larger than any you've seen before. Your grip tightens around your tools and you advance to finish the fight.
Each investigator loses all of their clues. Remove all clues from each location other than Heart of the Infection.

cards.flavor: Your companions follow your lead as the battle to eject the Colour enters its final stage.  Your journey from the first steps on the road to Oz now ends with the full brunt of the Colour focused on you.  Throw everything you have at it!
cards.name: Excise the Infection
cards.text: [free] Remove 2[per_investigator] damage from The Colour Out of Space or spend 1[per_investigator] clues as a group: Remove 1 doom from your location. Increase the cost of this ability by 1[per_investigator] damage or clues if there is 2 or fewer doom on Heart of the Infection. Forced - At the end of each investigator's turn, fully replenish the clues on Heart of the Infection. Objective - If there is no doom on Heart of the Infection, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: The Departure
cards.text:
The focus of the emerald prisms clashes against the alien glow of the Colour in a staggering display that nearly blinds you, but with one final maneuver, the bright green light carves deep into the impossible mass. A shockwave suddenly shoots out as the Colour blasts upward, knocking you off your feet. The spectacle at the Gardner farm where the Colour departed in a rising column is repeating, only magnified a hundred times. You scrabble to your feet -- a task made far more difficult by the terrain shattering and rising up in the incredible event. The departure will cause considerable damage, and you are nowhere near safety.
Place 2 doom on each [[Colour]] location.

cards.flavor: Tendrils and arcs of the Colour shoot out as the infectious entity rockets skyward.  Your only hope of surviving this event is to flee to the magical barrier at the Emerald City!
cards.name: To the Emerald City!
cards.text: As an additional cost to leave a location, for each doom on that location, you must spend an additional action, take 1 direct damage, or take 1 direct horror (choose one). Objective - If each undefeated investigator is at Emerald City, advance.

cards.name: Sanctuary!
cards.text:
You charge headlong through the shattering countryside, leveraging your strength and wits to stay out of reach of the wanton destruction. Minute after grueling minute until at last, you clear the crumbling treeline. Your companions keep frantic pace, helping each other from falling behind and rushing with you through the open gates of the city. Ozma and Glinda focus their magical power to seal the gate behind you, just in time to block a tremendous blast of alien energy. You lie on the cobblestones of the city street, breathing heavily and staring up at the sky, finally able to witness your victory in the retreating Colour.
((→R4))

cards.name: Heart of the Infection

cards.flavor:
Deep in the withered lands of Oz,
the Colour amasses in a derelict well...

Cascading Spectacle
cards.text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (5). If you fail, discard cards from your hand with a total of X or more skill icons, where X is the amount you failed by. If you cannot, take 2 horror instead.
