cards.flavor: Protected by Glinda and Ozma, the Emerald City is the one safe spot as the Colour spreads rampantly... for now.
cards.name: Emerald City
cards.text: X is equal to the current scenario number. [action]: Resign. You seek refuge from the destructive Colour.

cards.flavor: The magic and life have all been utterly drained away from the Emerald City during the siege.  There is little left but cracked stone and tarnished gems, but Ozma and Glinda maintain their protection of the survivors.
cards.name: Emerald City
cards.text: [action]: Resign. You seek refuge from the destructive Colour.

cards.flavor: The bright blue pastoral country of the Munchkins is the site of your current mission.  While you have business in the country, Glinda advises you to seek out the College of Athletic Arts near the city to speak with Professor Wogglebug.  She suggests that the Public Educator may have a plan to gain some deeper knowledge of the Colour.
cards.name: Campus Visit
cards.text: Objective - When an investigator enters College of Athletic Arts, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Prof. H.M. Wogglebug T.E.
cards.text: A group of students lounging on the commons directs you to the office of Professor Wogglebug. It comes as no real surprise that the educator is indeed a bug, and one the size of a human, but he carries himself with the jovial nature and inflated pride that you'd expect from the president of a fairyland college. "Ah, such a welcome assemblage!" he announces, "enter, and tell me everything!" You sum up the present danger as best you can, and the Wogglebug nods along, already attending to chemical equipment. "Yes, I think my early creation is just the sort of thing we need to deliver Oz from this predicament. One of my first inventions as head of the college was school pills to give the students their daily learning in a single swallow. I can condense them in a variety of flavors, from Arithmetic to Zoology. All we need is a pill to give us knowledge of this Colour, and we shall know its weaknesses at once!"

cards.flavor: The Wogglebug shepherds you back out of his lab at once.  "Of course to make a school pill of anything, you'd have to know it first, so you must go out there and experience the Colour!  Bring me back every bit of knowledge you obtain!"
cards.name: Practicum
cards.text: [reaction] After a [[Colour]] card at your location is defeated or discarded (including after resolving its effects), choose and discard a card from your hand or spend a resource: Place 1 clue on this act from the token bank. (Max once per card.) Objective - If there are 4[per_investigator] or more clues on this act, an investigator at College of Athletic Arts may advance. For each investigator in the Campaign Log who knows the Colour's scientific composition, reduce the clue requirement of this act by 2.

cards.name: Course Credit
cards.text:
Professor Wogglebug collects and organizes the samples and notes you return to him with great interest. Through a strange and painstaking process, the material is reduced to a small tablet the same unearthly hue as the Colour. The professor admires it with a raised eyebrow before popping it into his mouth and swallowing. Immediately, he collapses to the floor, his eyes wide and vibrating in a sort of seizure. You help rouse the Wogglebug, and he lies panting on the floor of his lab in a cold sweat. "I-It... worked! Good heavens, did it work... this sort of knowledge could never be taught to anyone sane. It's jarred me to my core -- me, the president of the college, shaken by knowledge!" He struggles upward and looks back to the chemistry set. "I will distill the rest into pills for your usage, but I implore you, take only one! Half of one, even!"
In your Campaign Log, under "Advantages," record School Pills. Choose an investigator at College of Athletic Arts to take control of the set-aside School Pills asset. If another act card is in play, continue playing. Otherwise, proceed to ((→R2)).

cards.flavor:
The Blue Forest covers much of Munchkin Country,
and takes a considerable amount of time to traverse.
cards.name: Blue Forest
cards.text: Investigators and enemies cannot leave Blue Forest during the same round that they entered Blue Forest.

cards.flavor:
"There was a pretty garden around the house, where blue trees and blue flowers grew in abundance and in one place were beds of blue cabbages, blue carrots and blue lettuce, all of which were delicious to eat."
-- The Patchwork Girl of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Blue Forest

cards.flavor: Resources for learning are readily available at the college, seeing as most of its students have already evacuated.
cards.name: College of Athletic Arts
cards.text: [reaction] After you draw any amount of cards at College of Athletic Arts: Draw 1 additional card.  Choose and shuffle a non-weakness card from your hand into your deck. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
"Then the party moved on again, and after crossing a broad river on a ferry and passing many fine farm houses that were dome shaped and painted a pretty green color, they came in sight of a large building that was covered with flags and bunting."
-- Ozma of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: College of Athletic Arts

cards.flavor: The former sorcerer Dr. Pipt and his wife Margolotte pack reluctantly to escape the Colour.  Despite no longer practicing magic, some useful formulas or ingredients may yet remain.
cards.name: Dr. Pipt's House
cards.text: [reaction] When you would discover any amount of clues from Dr. Pipt's House: Instead of discovering one of those clues, search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Spell, Ritual, or Augury card and draw it. Shuffle your deck. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
"It was a big house, round, as were all the Munchkin houses, and painted blue, which is the distinctive color
of the Munchkin Country of Oz."
-- The Patchwork Girl of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Dr. Pipt's House

cards.flavor: Jinjur -- having once attempted to take over Oz -- is a stubborn and combative girl, despite now living the life of a farmer.  She stands ready to attack anything invading her ranch.
cards.name: Jinjur's Ranch
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Deal 1 damage to a non-[[Elite]] enemy at Jinjur's Ranch.

cards.flavor:
"In the garden surrounding the house were neat rows of bushes bearing cream-puffs and macaroons, some of which were still green, but others ripe and ready to eat. Farther back were fields of caramels, and all the land seemed well cultivated and carefully tended."
--The Tin Woodman of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Jinjur's Ranch

cards.flavor:
The hungry plant wait patiently for you to get into
a routine before they attempt to grab you.
cards.name: Man-Eating Plant Grove
cards.text: Forced - After you perform the same type of action (types include activate, engage, evade, fight, investigate, move, play, resource, and draw) twice in a row at Man-Eating Plant Grove: You must take 1 damage or lose 1 action.

cards.flavor:
"The plants formed rows on both sides of the road and from each plant rose a dozen or more of the big broad leaves, which swayed continually from side to side, although no wind was blowing."
-- The Patchwork Girl of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Man-Eating Plant Grove

cards.flavor:
The steep slopes of the mountain prevent you
from gaining much insight without great effort.
cards.name: Mount Munch
cards.text: You cannot discover clues from Mount Munch unless you have drawn cards or gained resources this round.

cards.flavor:
"...and by noon the mountain was so close that they could admire its appearance. Its slopes were partly clothed with pretty evergreens, and its foot-hills were tufted with a slender waving bluegrass that had a tassel on the end of every blade."
--The Tin Woodman of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Mount Munch

cards.flavor: It's been a long time since Dorothy -- or anyone, for that matter -- has lived in the old Kansas farmhouse.
cards.name: Old Farmhouse
cards.text: While you are investigating Old Farmhouse, it gets -1 shroud value for every 5 cards in your discard pile (minimum 1).

cards.flavor:
"The cyclone had set the house down very gently -- for a cyclone -- in the midst of a country of marvelous beauty."
-- The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Old Farmhouse

cards.flavor:
Mere moments after stepping into the field of poppies,
you already begin to feel your eyelids droop.
You must stay awake at all costs!
cards.name: Poppy Field
cards.text: Forced - After you take an action at Poppy Field, if you are still at Poppy Field: You must take 1 horror or lose 1 action.

cards.flavor:
"Now it is well known that when there are many of
these flowers together their odor is so powerful that anyone who breathes it falls asleep, and if the sleeper is not carried away from the scent of the flowers,
he sleeps on and on forever."
--The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Poppy Field

cards.flavor: Will you follow the road wherever it may lead?
cards.name: Yellow Brick Road
cards.text: [action]: Move. Move directly to any unrevealed location.

cards.flavor:
"The road to the City of Emeralds is paved with yellow brick," said the Witch, "so you cannot miss it."
--The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Yellow Brick Road
School Pills
cards.text:
Fast.  Uses (3 doses).
[reaction] When an investigator at your location initiates an investigate attempt, exhaust School Pills and spend 1 dose: If this test is successful, discover 1 additional clue.  If this test succeeds by 3 or more, heal 1 horror from that investigator.

cards.flavor:
The enormous porcupine growls barbed words,
vowing revenge on those who once stole its spines.
cards.name: Chiss
cards.text: Hunter. X is equal to the current scenario number. Forced - After you attack Chiss, if Chiss is ready and you did not succeed by 2 or more: Take 1 damage.

cards.flavor: You venture out from the Emerald City into the country of the Winkies, a golden yellow in all directions.  As you depart, Glinda urges you to seek assistance from Vig, the Czarover of the city of Herku, deep in the wilderness.  He previously assisted Dorothy in one of her adventures by giving her doses of zosozo, a liquid that grants immense strength to anyone who drinks it.
cards.name: The Strength of Herku
cards.text: Objective - When an investigator enters Herku, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Vig the Czarover
cards.text: Your arrival at the city of Herku is met by an army of uniformed giants, each with a gold collar around their neck. They escort you to the palace in the center of the city, past crowds of thin and sad-looking people. An equally thin man with long whiskers and eyebrows meets you at the gates. "Welcome, dear travelers, to Herku. I am Vig, the Czarover, of course. Do not worry about the giants, as they are there for your protection. The people of Herku have such great strength that they might accidentally harm you." Despite appearances, the Czarover crushes a chunk of marble into dust between his palms to demonstrate. He appraises your group, noticing several familiar faces. "I trust that you are here for more of my precious zosozo?" You nod and begin to explain, but the Czarover shakes his head. "Whether or not I wish to grant you some, I am unable to produce it at this time. Strong as we are, my people do not wish to chance the effects of this alien thing, which leaves me short of materials to make it."

cards.flavor: You offer to gather the materials for the zosozo, and the Czarover smiles haughtily.  "I accept your offer, though I warn you, this will not be easy.  Zosozo is pure energy, and the process requires untainted plants and minerals.  If you gather me enough pure samples, I will make you plenty of zosozo."
cards.name: Residual Energy
cards.text: [action]: Test [willpower] or [combat] (4). This test gets +1 difficulty for each clue on your location. If you succeed, place a clue on this act from the token bank. (Max one success per location.) Objective - If there are 5 or more clues on this act, an investigator at Herku may advance. For each investigator in the Campaign Log who knows the Colour's full effects on the land, reduce the clue requirement of this act by 1.

cards.name: Energy Overflowing
cards.text:
You scour the country for the exact materials needed by the Czarover, leaving no stone unturned. With those materials in hand, you return to Herku and turn your bounty over to Vig. The thin man's eyes light up at your delivery, and he retreats to his laboratory, demanding time and secrecy. In a short amount of time, he returns with a golden vial proudly in hand. "As promised, the zosozo. Be warned, your bodies may not be able to withstand a high dosage, so take only a teaspoon at a time. It will be more than sufficient for any physical task. Why, I only take it once a year, and you've already seen my prodigious strength for yourself." It seems unlikely, but there are far more unlikely things already at work, so you accept the vial gladly.
In your Campaign Log, under "Advantages," record Zosozo. Choose an investigator at Herku to take control of the set-aside Zosozo asset. If another act card is in play, continue playing. Otherwise, proceed to ((→R2)).

cards.flavor:
This forest clearing is home to a clan of living stuffed bears.
Though reluctant, they might be persuaded to lend you aid.
cards.name: Bear Center
cards.text: [free] If there are no clues on Bear Center: Search the collection for a copy of Cherished Keepsake (level 0) and put it into play under the control of any investigator at Bear Center. (It is not added to that investigator's deck.) That asset does not take up any slots and gains "When Cherished Keepsake leaves play or the game ends, instead remove it from the game." (Group limit once per game.)

cards.flavor:
"But after a time they reached a large, circular space in the center of the forest, which was clear of any stumps or underbrush.  The ground was covered by a soft gray moss, pleasant to tread upon.  All the trees surrounding this space seemed to be hollow and had round holes in their trunks, set a little way above the ground..."
-- The Lost Princess of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Bear Center

cards.flavor: The people of Herku are immensely strong, with ten captive giants also serving them.  This will not protect the city from the Colour's corruption, but immediate threats will be easily repelled.
cards.name: Herku
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, each non-[[Elite]] enemy at Herku disengages from each investigator and moves to a connecting location.

cards.flavor:
"...it was a square city, with a square, four-sided wall around it and on each side was a square gate of burnished copper.  Everything about the city looked solid and substantial; there were no banners flying and the towers that rose above the city wall seemed bare of any ornament whatever."
-- The Lost Princess of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Herku

cards.flavor: Jack's garden grows rapidly and steadily, giving you an easily accessible place to observe the Colour's changes.
cards.name: Jack Pumpkinhead's House
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, if there are 1 or more investigators at Jack Pumpkinhead's House, add 1 clue to it from the token bank (2 clues instead if there are 3 or 4 investigators in the game).

cards.flavor:
"They walked over to a monstrous big, hollow pumpkin which had a door and windows cut through the rind. There was a stovepipe running through the stem, and six steps had been built leading up to the front door."
-- The Road to Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Jack Pumpkinhead's House

cards.flavor:
The whirling mountains bounce you about uncontrollably,
leaving it entirely up to chance where you will end up.
cards.name: Merry-Go-Round Mountains
cards.text: Forced - When you would move from Merry-Go-Round Mountains, reveal a random chaos token. If you reveal a token with an odd-numbered modifier, you must either take 1 damage or move to a different location. (Max once per move.) [reaction] When you would move from Merry-Go-Round Mountains, spend an additional action: Ignore the above forced effect.

cards.flavor:
"From a distance the mountains appeared indistinct and seemed rather small -- more like hills than mountains -- but as the travelers drew nearer they noted a most unusual circumstance: the hills were all whirling around, some in one direction and some the opposite way."
-- The Lost Princess of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Merry-Go-Round Mountains

cards.flavor: Though opulent, the Scarecrow has ensured that his home is a place that encourages thought and reflection.
cards.name: Scarecrow's Mansion
cards.text: [reaction] When you would discard 1 or more cards at Scarecrow's Mansion during the upkeep phase: Instead, shuffle those cards into your deck.

cards.flavor:
"The Scarecrow's new house was shaped like an immense ear of corn.  The rows of kernels were made of solid gold, and the green upon which the ear stood upright was a mass of sparkling emeralds.  Upon the very top of the structure was perched a figure representing
the Scarecrow himself"
-- The Emerald City of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Scarecrow's Mansion

cards.flavor:
Having seen through the illusions around the city,
you meet the wealthy thistle-eaters of Thi, who have
heart-shaped bodies and diamond-shaped heads.
cards.name: Thi
cards.text: [reaction] After you gain 1 or more resources during an action at Thi: Gain 1 additional resource. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
"So on they went, directly toward the city, which seemed only a couple of miles distant; but when they had traveled less than a mile it suddenly disappeared again."
-- The Lost Princess of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Thi
cards.text: As an additional cost to enter Thi, investigators at locations connected to Thi must control 3[per_investigator] or more clues as a group.

cards.flavor: The tin palace is staffed and maintained by an army of skilled tinsmiths, glad to assist friends of the emperor.
cards.name: Tin Woodman's Palace
cards.text:
[action]: Add 1 ammo or supply to an asset you control.
[action]: Heal 1 damage or horror from an [[Item]] asset you control.

cards.flavor:
"And now, as the brilliant sun sank low over the Winkie Country of Oz, tinting the glistening tin towers and tin minarets of the tin castle with glorious sunset hues..."
-- The Tin Woodman of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Tin Woodman's Palace

cards.flavor: "My magic works only one way. I can do things, but I can't un do them. You'll have to find the Truth Pond, and bathe in its water." -- The Road to Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Truth Pond
cards.text: [action]: Discard a treachery in your play area or threat area.  In the Campaign Log, record that you "bathed in the Truth Pond."  (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
This is
THE TRUTH POND
Whoever bathes in this
water must always
afterward tell
THE TRUTH
-- Inscription on the Truth Pond plaque
cards.name: Truth Pond

cards.flavor:
Though abandoned after the witch's defeat by Dorothy,
the castle still stands as both a memorial and a reminder.
An aura of malevolent magic still permeates the grounds.
cards.name: Witch of the West's Castle
cards.text: Forced - After you play or activate an ability on a [[Spell]] or [[Ritual]] card at Witch of the West's Castle: Take 1 horror or discard a card from your hand at random.

cards.flavor:
"Dorothy obeyed the old woman and followed her past the great halls of the castle, which were all carpeted in yellow velvet with yellow tapestries hung upon the walls."
-- The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Witch of the West's Castle
Zosozo
cards.text:
Fast.  Uses (3 doses).
[reaction] When an investigator at your location initiates an attack attempt, exhaust Zosozo and spend 1 dose: This attack deals +1 damage.  If this test succeeds by 3 or more, heal 1 damage from that investigator.

cards.flavor: The skies darken as clouds move in ahead of an enormous monster, spewing fire and licking its chops hungrily.
cards.name: The Rak
cards.text: Hunter. X is equal to the current scenario number. Forced - At the end of the round, deal 1 damage to each investigator and non-[[Elite]] enemy at The Rak's location.

cards.flavor: You step out from the city toward the red-tinged Quadling country -- the same land you flew over when you first arrived.  Glinda informs you that her own palace lies in the heart of the country, and that she herself will accompany you to retrieve one of her most treasured and powerful magic items -- the Great Book of Records, which gives her information of every event in Oz as it happens.
cards.name: Full Account
cards.text: Objective - When an investigator enters Glinda's Palace, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Nursing a Grudge
cards.text: You approach Glinda's palace to find the servants in utter disarray, clustering together fearfully. At the good witch's entrance, one young maiden rushes up with a hurried curtsy. "Your grace, there's an intruder! She broke into your magic room and took the book of records with her!" Glinda clenches her jaw and motions for you to follow her quickly, wand at the ready. The two of you burst into the magic room to find it filled with acrid smoke. A witch with scraggly black hair and an eyepatch chants steadily as she waves her hands over a large book with five locks binding it shut. Glinda points her wand and with a single utterance, the witch freezes in place. The hag curses and sputters as her spell dies down, but Glinda remains stoic. You remove any tools or reagents from the witch's reach before restraining her. Glinda lowers her wand and studies the intruder carefully. "...yes, I thought I knew you. From Jinxland, the witch called Blinkie." The hag's one eye fixes on Glinda hatefully. "Yes! It took years to recover this spell after you stripped my magic from me, but my revenge on you is complete! Your precious Book of Records is forever lost to you!"

cards.flavor: Blinkie continues her ranting.  "The other witches may have delusions of power, but I have seen the true source of the Colour, and there is only decay!  It will destroy all of Oz, but not until I've had my revenge!  I don't care if it's all destroyed, so long as you wallow in ignorance while it happens!"  Glinda stands back unnerved, but you assure her that you will find a way to recover the five lost keys.  You just have to think like Blinkie.
cards.name: The Five Locks
cards.text: [free] If you are at a location with no clues on it, investigators at your location discard cards from their hand with a total of 2[per_investigator] or more skill icons: Place 1 clue on this act from the token bank. (Max once per location.) Objective - If there are 5 clues on this act, an investigator at Glinda's Palace may advance. For each investigator in the Campaign Log who knows the Colour's true origin, reduce the icon requirement for the above action by 2.

cards.name: The Great Book of Records
cards.text:
You return at last to Glinda's magic room with the five keys in hand. The good witch breathes a long, relieved sigh while Blinkie begins a furious tantrum at the sight of them. "Curse you! Curse you a thousand times you... you wretched, feeble, insignificant--" You take a bold step toward the hag and she goes silent with a nervous look. Glinda smirks quietly at Blinkie, who scowls bitterly in return. Unfazed, you insert the five keys into the locks and open the book. Skimming through, you can see the entire history of Oz, and on the current final page, the most recent entry mentioning your recovery of the five keys. Glinda looks over your shoulder as you read. "Learning of the Colour's activity as it happens will greatly aid our coordination." Blinkie mutters something about imminent doom, but otherwise keeps sullenly silent.
In your Campaign Log, under "Advantages," record Great Book of Records. Choose an investigator at Glinda's Palace to take control of the set-aside Great Book of Records asset. It does not take up any slots for the remainder of the scenario. If another act card is in play, continue playing. Otherwise, proceed to ((→R2)).

cards.flavor: The delicate town and people are at risk of being fractured by taller folk, to say nothing of the Colour.
cards.name: China Country
cards.text: Forced - After you resolve a test at China Country, if you did not succeed by 1 or more: Lose an action.

cards.flavor:
"Before them was a great stretch of country having a floor as smooth and shining and white as the bottom of
a big platter.  Scattered around were many houses made entirely of china and painted in the brightest colors.
These houses were quite small, the biggest of them reaching only as high as Dorothy’s waist."
-- The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: China Country

cards.flavor:
The fighting trees are protectors of the forest of a sort,
and try to eject any possible threats immediately.
cards.name: Fighting Tree Grove
cards.text: Forced - After you resolve an action at Fighting Tree Grove, if you are still at Fighting Tree Grove: Reveal a random chaos token. If you reveal a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], [elder_thing], [curse], or [auto_fail] token, move once toward Emerald City.

cards.flavor:
"The Scarecrow, who was in the lead, finally discovered a big tree with such wide-spreading branches that there was room for the party to pass underneath.  So he walked forward to the tree, but just as he came under the first branches they bent down and twined around him, and the next minute he was raised from the ground and flung headlong among his fellow travelers."
-- The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Fighting Tree Grove

cards.flavor: The beasts of the forest are subservient to the Lion and Hungry Tiger, and while they aren't nearly as willing to face danger, they can run some interference.
cards.name: Forest of Wild Beasts
cards.text: Forced - After an enemy enters Forest of Wild Beasts: It loses hunter until the end of the next round.

cards.flavor:
"...and they kept along the well-trodden path until they came to an opening in the wood, in which were gathered hundreds of beasts of every variety. There were tigers and elephants and bears and wolves and foxes and all the others in the natural history..."
-- The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Forest of Wild Beasts

cards.flavor:
Though usually stocked with magical paraphernalia,
the recent intrusion has depleted Glinda's supply.
cards.name: Glinda's Palace
cards.text: While you are investigating Glinda's Palace, it gets -1 shroud value for each arcane slot you have filled (to a minimum of 1 shroud).

cards.flavor:
"So they entered a place that was surrounded by
the wings of the great castle but had no roof, and
was filled with flowers and fountains and exquisite statuary and many settees and chairs of polished
marble or filigree gold."
-- The Magic of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Glinda's Palace

cards.flavor:
The great waterfall flows in on itself infinitely,
but to fully explore it, you will have to risk leaping in.
cards.name: Great Waterfall
cards.text: [action] Test [combat] or [agility] (4).  If you succeed, discover a clue from Great Waterfall.  If you fail, you must take 1 damage or lose an action.

cards.flavor:
"By and by they came to the waterfall itself,
a sheet of silver dropping far, far down into a tiny lake
which seemed to have no outlet."
-- The Scarecrow of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Great Waterfall

cards.flavor: The territorial and disagreeable hammer-heads strike out at anyone attempting to scale their hill.
cards.name: Hammer-Head Hill
cards.text: Forced - At the end of your turn, if you did not successfully investigate, fight, or evade at Hammer-Head Hill: Take 1 damage and move to a connecting location.

cards.flavor:
"As quick as lightning the man’s head shot forward and his neck stretched out until the top of the head, where it was flat, struck the Scarecrow in the middle and sent
him tumbling, over and over, down the hill.  Almost as
quickly as it came the head went back to the body,
and the man laughed harshly..."
-- The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Hammer-Head Hill

cards.flavor: The surly one-legged Hoppers and the eclectic carefree Horners often quarrel with each other, making things difficult to navigate without sorting out their problems.
cards.name: Hoppers and Horners' Mountain
cards.text: [action]: Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, reduce the shroud value of Hoppers and Horners' Mountain's by 2 until the end of your turn. (Limit once per turn.)

cards.flavor:
"It was a magnificent cave, illumined by the soft, invisible light, so that everything in it could be plainly seen. The walls were of polished marble, white with veins of delicate colors running through it, and the roof was arched and carved in designs both fantastic and beautiful."
-- The Patchwork Girl of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Hoppers and Horners' Mountain

cards.flavor:
It takes some effort to bridge the chasm and scale the mountains surrounding Jinxland, but you are now free
to come and go as you please.
cards.name: Jinxland
cards.text: [reaction] After you draw 1 or more cards during an action at Jinxland: Draw 1 additional card. (Limit once per round.)

cards.flavor:
"Of course witches are forbidden to exist in the Land of Oz, but Jinxland was so far removed from the center of Ozma’s dominions, and so absolutely cut off from it by the steep mountains and the bottomless gulf, that the laws of Oz were not obeyed very well in that country."
-- The Scarecrow of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Jinxland
cards.text: As an additional cost to enter Jinxland, investigators at locations connected to Jinxland must control 3[per_investigator] or more clues as a group.

cards.flavor:
The flow of the river is unpredictable,
making any attempt to cross a risky proposition.
cards.name: Trick River
cards.text: Forced - When you would move from Trick River: Test [willpower] or [agility] (3). If you fail, cancel the effects of the move. (Max once per round per investigator.)

cards.flavor:
"They had floated several miles down the stream
and were enjoying the ride when suddenly the raft
slowed up, stopped short, and then began to float
back the way it had come."
-- The Patchwork Girl of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Trick River
Great Book of Records
cards.text:
Uses (4 secrets).
Play with the top card of the encounter deck revealed.  Revelation effects on the top card are not triggered until the card is drawn.
[free] Exhaust Great Book of Records, spend 1 secret, and choose a location: Reduce the difficulty of all tests made at that location by 1 until the end of the current turn.

cards.flavor:
The giant advances towards you, bellowing about
how much he's missed the taste of meat people.
cards.name: The Yoop
cards.text:
Hunter.
X is equal to the current scenario number.
If there are 1 or more [[Ally]] assets at The Yoop's location, The Yoop gets +1 horror and gains alert.

cards.flavor: The muted purple hues of Gillikin country lie ahead of you in your current quest.  Glinda mentions as you go that there is a powerful sorceress in the northernmost reaches of the country.  Reera the Red is a yookoohoo -- one that specializes in transformation magic.  Her expertise may help combat the corrupt transformations of the Colour, but Reera is a reclusive woman.
cards.name: Transformer Supreme
cards.text: Objective - When an investigator enters Reera's House, you must immediately advance.

cards.name: Reera the Yookoohoo
cards.text: You push open the door to the rustic house and find the inside grim and forbidding. Spiders, rats, and other creatures creep about the floors while a huge gray ape sits on a bench, knitting. "What do you seek in my home," the ape asks curtly, "speak or leave me." You accept Reera's current form with a little hesitation and explain the current situation with the Colour. Reera continues her knitting without concern. "This is all unfortunate, but I may leave Oz if it is doomed. Why should I help you to drive it out?" You ask Reera what she would want in return for her assistance, but still she remains aloof. "I do not want for anything, as my magic allows me to obtain it easily. There is nothing you could offer me that I do not already have." The creatures around her scuttle nearer to you, but you remain firm. If Reera is going to force a stalemate, then you intend to wait it out. Tense seconds pass as you ignore the threatening creatures until finally Reera looks up from her knitting -- the first time she's actually looked at you.

cards.flavor: Reera studies your face for signs of fear and slowly rises.  Her form begins to shift, as does the house and creatures around you.  "Your mission does not interest me.  You, however, might.  Bravery is a rare thing in this peaceful country, but I see a strong conviction in your eyes.  Show me your courage when faced with the ever-changing and unknowable.  Try to understand a yookoohoo's magic, if you can."
cards.name: Test of Bravery
cards.text: [reaction] After you discover 1 or more clues from Reera's House: Place an equal amount of clues on this act, from the token bank. Objective - If there are 3[per_investigator] clues on this act, an investigator at Reera's House may advance. For each investigator in the Campaign Log who knows the Colour's full effects on the body, reduce the clue requirement of this act by 2.

cards.name: Without Fear
cards.text:
Reera and her household continue to shift, confounding and menacing you as you try to understand her transformations. Gradually, you spot the patterns and keep your nerve against her scare tactics. You predict some of the changes out loud, causing Reera to falter momentarily as she adapts to you instead of the other way around. After a series of correct guesses, the house rapidly returns to normal, but Reera herself shifts into an entirely new form. Standing before you is a graceful woman with red hair and a stern -- but interested -- look on her face. "Most intriguing. You are more perceptive than I imagined, and far more brave. I agree to assist you in fighting this Colour. Only you, mind you."
In your Campaign Log, under "Advantages," record Reera's Help. Choose an investigator at Reera's House to take control of the set-aside Reera the Red asset. She does not take up any slots for the remainder of the scenario. If another act card is in play, continue playing. Otherwise, proceed to ((→R2)).

cards.flavor: The eponymous Flatheads once carried their brains around in cans in their pockets until they were granted normal heads by Glinda some years ago.  They are now ruled by the three Adepts -- a trio of sorceresses.
cards.name: Flathead Mountain
cards.text: [action]: Parley. You seek guidance from the three Adepts. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (3). If you succeed, reduce the difficulty of the next test you take by 3.

cards.flavor:
"...the Flatheads grunted with satisfaction and drew back, permitting them to see what the mountain top looked like. It was shaped like a saucer, so that the houses and other buildings—all made of rocks—could not be seen over the edge by anyone standing in the plain below."
-- Glinda of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Flathead Mountain

cards.flavor: The eponymous King Gugu -- a huge yellow leopard -- rules the forests of Gillikin country, and does not hesitate to defend them against invaders.
cards.name: Forest of Gugu
cards.text: Forced - At the end of the round, deal 1 damage to a non-[[Elite]] enemy at Forest of Gugu.

cards.flavor:
"In the central western part of the Gillikin Country is a great tangle of trees called Gugu Forest.  It is the biggest forest in all Oz and stretches miles and miles in every direction -- north, south, east and west."
-- The Magic of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Forest of Gugu

cards.flavor:
The sprawling mountains hold a great many secrets
for those patient enough to seek them out.
cards.name: Gillikin Mountains
cards.text: [reaction] After you begin your turn at Gillikin Mountains: You cannot move or be moved until the end of the round.  You gain 1 additional action this turn.

cards.flavor:
"She had met a crooked wizard who resided in
a lonely cave in the mountains, and had traded
several important secrets of magic with him."
-- The Marvelous Land of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Gillikin Mountains

cards.flavor: The island is able to submerge in times of trouble, controlled by magical machinery beneath the city.
cards.name: Island of the Skeezers
cards.text: [action]: Parley. You appeal to Queen Aurex to submerge the island. Investigators and enemies cannot enter or leave Island of the Skeezers until the end of the round.

cards.flavor:
"In the center of this lake appeared a lovely island, not of great extent but almost entirely covered by a huge round building with glass walls and a high glass dome which glittered brilliantly in the sunshine."
-- Glinda of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Island of the Skeezers

cards.flavor:
The magic isle physically roots trespassers in place,
unless they take the necessary precautions.
cards.name: Magic Isle
cards.text: Forced - After you investigate the Magic Isle: Lose 1 action. [reaction] When you initiate an investigate action at the Magic Isle, spend 2 resources: Ignore the above forced ability.

cards.flavor:
"But then the girl exclaimed: "How funny it is,
Cap'n Bill, that nothing else grows here excep'
the Magic Flower."  Then the sailor glanced at
the island and saw that it was all bare ground,
without a weed, a stone or a blade of grass."
-- The Magic of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Magic Isle

cards.flavor:
You can scarcely see your hand before your face,
but you can gradually feel out the hidden landscape.
cards.name: Mist Valley
cards.text: While you are investigating Mist Valley, it gets -1 shroud value for each action you have performed at Mist Valley this round.

cards.flavor:
"From the top of the hill Ozma and Dorothy looked down into the valley beyond and were surprised to find it filled with a floating mist that was as dense as smoke. Nothing in the valley was visible except these rolling waves of mist..."
-- Glinda of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Mist Valley
Reera's House
cards.text: Enemies at Reera's House may be attacked or evaded using any skill instead of the skill indicated. Reera's House may be investigated using any skill. Forced - After you succeed at a skill test during your turn at Reera's House: You cannot choose to use that skill until the end of the round. (Limit 3 times per round.)

cards.flavor:
"On the floor just before Ervic lay a great crocodile, its red eyes gleaming wickedly and its wide open mouth displaying rows of sharp teeth. Horned toads hopped about; each of the four upper corners of the room was festooned with a thick cobweb..."
-- Glinda of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Reera's House

cards.flavor:
The winged monkeys are curious and mischievous,
and content to pester you despite the invading Colour.
cards.name: Winged Monkeys' Forest
cards.text: Forced - When you would draw any amount of cards from your deck at Winged Monkeys' Forest: Draw 1 additional card. Then, choose and discard a non-weakness card.

cards.flavor:
"Once," began the leader, "we were a free people, living happily in the great forest, flying from tree to tree, eating nuts and fruit, and doing just as we pleased without calling anybody master.  Perhaps some of us were rather too full of mischief at times..."
-- The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Winged Monkeys' Forest

cards.flavor:
This castle was once the home of fearsome giants.
Though it has been abandoned since their defeat, the castle is difficult to traverse for anyone human-sized.
cards.name: Yoop Castle
cards.text: [[Colour]] enemies at Yoop Castle gain the massive keyword.

cards.flavor:
"...when they had topped a higher hill than usual, they discovered a cup-shaped valley before them in the center of which stood an enormous castle, built of purple stone."
-- The Tin Woodman of Oz, L. Frank Baum
cards.name: Yoop Castle
Reera the Red
cards.text: Uses (3 charges). You get +1 [willpower]. [free] Spend 1 charge, choose an asset you control, and name a slot type (hand, arcane, ally, accessory, body, tarot): That asset loses one of its slots and gains the named slot instead until that asset leaves play.

cards.flavor: The giantess declares vengeance against Ozma and Oz for years spent trapped in the form of a green monkey.
cards.name: Mrs. Yoop
cards.text:
Hunter.
X is equal to the current scenario number.
Each event played by investigators at Mrs. Yoop's location costs 1 additional resource.

cards.name: Oversaturation
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Oversaturation to your location. Attached location gains the [[Colour]] trait. Decay 2 -- Deal 2 horror to each investigator at this location and each connecting location. Discard Oversaturation. [action] Choose and discard half of the cards in your hand (rounded up, minimum 1): Discard Oversaturation.

cards.flavor:
"Things moved and changed and fluttered, and ears tingled to impulses which were not wholly sounds."
-- H.P. Lovecraft, The Colour Out of Space
cards.name: Pulsing Life
cards.text: Revelation - Put Pulsing Life into play in your threat area. Decay 2 -- Deal 2 damage to each investigator at this location and discard Pulsing Life. [action] Spend 1 resource: Discard Pulsing Life.

cards.flavor:
"Most of the creatures seemed not quite usual in their aspects and motions, and their nocturnal habits contradicted all former experience."
-- H.P. Lovecraft, The Colour Out of Space
cards.name: Vivid Beast
cards.text: Hunter. Decay 1 -- Vivid Beast gets -2 fight, but +1 horror until the end of the next round.

cards.name: Desiccation
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Desiccation to your location. Attached location gains the [[Colour]] trait. Decay 2 -- Deal 3 horror to each investigator at this location and discard Desiccation. [action] Choose and discard half of the cards in your hand (rounded up, minimum 1): Discard Desiccation.

cards.flavor:
"...she was being drained of something — something
was fastening itself on her that ought not to be..."
-- H.P. Lovecraft, The Colour Out of Space
cards.name: Leeched Away
cards.text: Revelation - Put Leeched Away into play in your threat area. Decay 2 -- Deal 3 damage to each investigator at this location and discard Leeched Away. [action] Spend 1 resource: Discard Leeched Away.

cards.flavor:
"The swine began growing grey and brittle and falling to pieces before they died, and their eyes and muzzles developed singular alterations."
-- H.P. Lovecraft, The Colour Out of Space
cards.name: Crumbling Wretch
cards.text: Hunter. Decay 1 -- Crumbling Wretch gets -2 fight, but +1 horror until the end of the next round.

cards.name: Chromatic Infection
cards.text: Revelation - Put Chromatic Infection into play in your threat area. You gain the [[Colour]] trait. All damage and horror dealt to you by [[Colour]] cards is considered to be direct damage or horror. [action] [action]: Discard Chromatic Infection.

cards.name: The Colour Out of Space
cards.text: Massive. Pervasive -- Each location with 1 or more doom on it. While you are fighting or evading The Colour Out of Space, it gets +X fight and evade, where X is the amount of doom on your location. Forced - At the end of each investigator's turn: Ready The Colour Out of Space.

cards.name: Boon Companions
cards.text: Permanent. [free] During a test you are performing, exhaust Boon Companions: Choose a companion asset. You get +X skill value for this test, where X is the number of matching skill icons on the chosen asset. [free] During your turn, exhaust Boon Companions: Activate the Companion ability on a companion asset. Boon Companions does not ready during the next upkeep phase.

cards.flavor:
Cap'n Bill is a veteran of many voyages,
and his weathered sailor's coat has all manner of
useful items stowed in its many pockets.
cards.name: Cap'n Bill
cards.text: Companion. Companion -- Play an [[Item]] asset, paying its cost.

cards.flavor: Jack Pumpkinhead is simple, but not as foolish as he looks.  His occasional seeds of wisdom can keep you prepared.
cards.name: Jack Pumpkinhead
cards.text: Companion. Companion -- Choose a card in your discard pile. Shuffle that card into your deck.

cards.flavor:
The Shaggy Man is easy to underestimate,
but he has many hidden talents that he can call on
when his friends are in trouble.
cards.name: Shaggy Man
cards.text: Companion. Companion -- Search the top 3 cards of your deck for a skill and draw it. Shuffle your deck.

cards.flavor: The Cowardly Lion considers himself a coward, but he won't hesitate to leap into action on behalf of his friends.
cards.name: The Cowardly Lion
cards.text: Companion. Companion -- Engage. The engaged enemy gets -1 damage and -1 horror during each attack against you this round.

cards.flavor:
Though the Frogman prides himself on his wisdom and truthfulness, his real strength lies in his powerful legs,
allowing him to leap nimbly out of harm's way.
cards.name: The Frogman
cards.text: Companion. Companion -- Your next action does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

cards.flavor: Though not nearly as vicious as he means to be, the Hungry Tiger's size and sharpened teeth are intimidating.
cards.name: The Hungry Tiger
cards.text: Companion. Companion -- Choose an enemy. That enemy loses retaliate and alert until the end of your turn. If the target is non-Elite, it cannot target you while resolving the hunter keyword until the end of the round.

cards.flavor:
The Patchwork Girl is unfocused to say the least,
tumbling and standing on her hands at random.
However, her sudden ideas can be highly useful.
cards.name: The Patchwork Girl
cards.text: Companion. Companion -- Search the top 3 cards of your deck for an event and draw it. Shuffle your deck.

cards.flavor: Nothing can keep up with the Sawhorse's sheer speed, though it can be a little disorienting to ride him.
cards.name: The Sawhorse
cards.text: Companion. Companion -- Choose and discard a card from your hand. Then, disengage from each non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location and move to a connecting location.

cards.flavor: The Scarecrow is a fountain of knowledge, and is eager to share his wisdom with anyone in need of it.
cards.name: The Scarecrow
cards.text: Companion. Companion -- Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
The Tin Woodman's axe is polished and sharp.
He is ready to defend his friends from danger.
cards.name: The Tin Woodman
cards.text: Companion. Companion -- Draw the top card of the encounter deck. You get +1 skill value while resolving any of its effects until the end of the round. During the next mythos phase, you do not draw an encounter card.

cards.flavor:
The Wizard is never without his black bag of
magical paraphernalia.  Inside, you can find
any tool or reagent imaginable for spellcasting.
cards.name: The Wizard
cards.text: Companion. Companion -- Play a Spell, Ritual, or Augury asset, paying its cost.

cards.flavor: Tik-Tok is a bit slow, but certainly dependable.  His mechanical logic and actions are reliable above all else.
cards.name: Tik-Tok
cards.text: Companion. Companion -- Seal any 3 non-[auto_fail] tokens on Tik-Tok. At the end of your turn, return those tokens to the chaos bag.

cards.flavor:
Your companions freeze at the terrible sight, reminding you just how inexperienced they are
in matters of cosmic horror.
cards.name: Frightened Stiff
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Exhaust each copy of Boon Companions.

cards.name: Bestial Hunger
cards.text: Revelation - Put Bestial Hunger into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When damage from a [[Creature]] enemy's attack is dealt to an asset you control: Defeat that asset. Forced - At the end of the round, if there is a non-[[Elite Creature]] enemy in play: Discard Bestial Hunger.

cards.flavor:
"They had just started to cross this queer bridge when a sharp growl made them all look up, and to their horror they saw running toward them two great beasts with bodies like bears and heads like tigers."
<right>-- L. Frank Baum, The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
cards.name: Kalidah
cards.text: Hunter. Forced - After Kalidah readies: Immediately move it one location toward the nearest investigator.

cards.flavor:
"At once there came running to her from all directions
a pack of great wolves. They had long legs and
fierce eyes and sharp teeth."
<right>-- L. Frank Baum, The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
cards.name: Wild Wolf
cards.text: Hunter. Retaliate. Alert. Forced - After Wild Wolf makes an attack via the retaliate or alert keywords: It loses retaliate and alert until the end of the round.

cards.name: Contaminated Citizen
cards.text: Nearest location with 1 or more cards with Decay X. Forced - After you deal damage in excess of Contaminated Citizen's health: Take 1 horror and remove 1 horror from each card at your location with Decay X.

cards.name: Seeped In
cards.text: Revelation - Attach Seeped In to an asset you control (with a printed ability, if possible). Attached card gains the [[Colour]] trait. As an additional cost to trigger or activate an ability on the attached asset, take 1 damage or 1 horror. Decay 3 -- Discard Seeped In. [action]: Remove 1 horror from Seeped In.

cards.name: Tainted Supplies
cards.text: Revelation - Put Tainted Supplies into play in your threat area. Decay 2 -- Lose all of your resources and discard Tainted Supplies. [action]: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Tainted Supplies.

cards.name: Masterwork Weaponry
cards.text: Revelation - Put Masterwork Weaponry into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When a non-[[Elite Humanoid]] enemy enters play: Attach Masterwork Weaponry to that enemy. (Max 1 per enemy.) Attached enemy gets +1 fight and +1 damage.

cards.flavor:
"It was evident they were perfectly trained, for they stood in straight rows, rank after rank, with their weapons held erect and true, as if awaiting but the word of command
to level them upon their foes."
-- L. Frank Baum, Ozma of Oz
cards.name: Nome Soldier
cards.text: Hunter. Forced - When you would defeat Nome Soldier, if you are at Nome Soldier's location: Lose 1 action or it attacks you (you must choose one).

cards.name: Through the Earth
cards.text: Revelation - Put Through the Earth into play next to the agenda deck. Each [[Nome]] enemy gets +1 horror. During the enemy phase, all locations are considered to be connected to one another for [[Nome]] enemies. Forced - At the end of the round, if there is a non-[[Elite Nome]] enemy in play: Discard Through the Earth.

cards.flavor: Dorothy has traveled more of Oz than most others, and is never far from her close friends in her journeys.
cards.name: Dorothy Gale
cards.text: [free] Exhaust Dorothy Gale: Ready a copy of Boon Companions at your location.  Dorothy Gale does not ready during the next upkeep phase.

cards.name: Prismatic Evils
cards.text: Peril. Revelation - You must (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance. - Attach Prismatic Evils to a non-story asset you control. While it is attached to an asset, it gains "Decay 2 -- Place 2 doom on the current agenda. This effect can cause the current agenda to advance. Discard the attached asset."

cards.flavor:
"Nothin’ . . . nothin’ . . . the colour . . .
it burns . . . cold an’ wet . . . but it burns . . ."
-- H.P. Lovecraft, The Colour Out of Space
cards.name: Spiraling Decay
cards.text: Surge. Revelation - Remove 1 horror from each enemy and treachery with Decay X.

cards.name: Alien Aurora
cards.text: Revelation - Put Alien Aurora into play next to the agenda deck. Search the chaos bag for the two highest non-symbol chaos tokens and seal them on Alien Aurora. [action] Place 1 of your clues on your location: Discard Alien Aurora.

cards.name: Chromophobia
cards.text: Revelation - If there is no copy of Chromophobia in your threat area, put it into play in your threat area. Otherwise, it gains surge. Forced - After you draw a [[Colour]] encounter card: Take 1 horror. [action]: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Chromophobia.

cards.name: Chromatic Aberration
cards.text: Hunter. While there is a card at Chromatic Aberration's location with Decay X, it gets +1 fight and gains retaliate. While there are 2 or more cards at Chromatic Aberration's location with Decay X, it gains massive.

cards.name: Pooling Hues
cards.text: Revelation - Put Pooling Hues into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - When a [[Colour]] enemy would enter the discard pile: Instead, spawn it at the furthest location from all investigators. Forced - At the end of the round, if there is a non-[[Elite Colour]] enemy at a location: Discard Pooling Hues.

cards.name: Vibrant Semifluid
cards.text: Hunter. Forced - When Vibrant Semifluid is defeated: Attach it to your location and place 2 horror on it. While it is attached to a location, Vibrant Semifluid cannot have cards attached to it and gains: "Decay 2 -- Each investigator at the attached location discards a card from their hand at random and loses 1 resource. Discard Vibrant Semifluid."

cards.name: Curse of the Frozen Heart
cards.text: Revelation - Put Curse of the Frozen Heart into play in your threat area. Treat the text box of each [[Ally]] and [[Favor]] asset you control as if they were blank (except for Traits). [action] [action]: Discard Curse of the Frozen Heart. You may exhaust an [[Ally]] or [[Favor]] asset you control to reduce this ability's cost by 1 action.

cards.name: Powder and Smoke
cards.text: Revelation - Put Powder and Smoke into play in your threat area and choose your highest skill. Forced - When you initiate a test that uses the chosen skill: Discard a card from your hand at random. [action]: Test the chosen skill (3). If you succeed, discard Powder and Smoke.

cards.flavor:
The witches of Arkham seem almost friendly
compared to the maniacal hag threatening you.
cards.name: Renegade Witch
cards.text: Hunter. Forced - When an investigator at Renegade Witch's location plays or activates an ability on a Spell, Ritual, Hex or Curse card: Renegade Witch gets +1 fight and +1 evade until the end of the round.
